Job Title and Description: Search Engine Optimization Strategist About The Job Are you a dynamic and results-driven SEO professional with a passion for maximizing online visibility and revenue? We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated SEO Strategist to join our team. As a key player, you will be responsible for driving organic traffic, enhancing search engine rankings, and optimizing our client's business to achieve unparalleled success. What We Offer Basic Salary ranges from $71K to $100K (negotiable based on experience). Bonus: Earn up to $2,500 per quarter. Benefits: 401(k) with matching Dental Insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Vision insurance Qualifications Required 3+ years of experience in digital marketing with an emphasis on SEO Minimum of 1 year SEO experience with on-site optimization and copywriting A clear understanding of how SEO fits into a larger online marketing strategy and interacts with other marketing tactics Experience managing 4+ client relationships simultaneously Stellar written and verbal communication skills shown in navigating emotionally charged conversations, creating clarity in emails, creating meaningful dialogue during presentations, etc. Preferred Relevant Certifications: Google Analytics Prior experience with Lead Generation and E-Commerce businesses Responsibilities Keyword Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive keyword research to identify high-value and relevant keywords for product pages. Analyze competitor keywords and industry trends to stay ahead of the curve. On-Page Optimization: Optimize product pages for search engines, strategically placing content, meta tags, and headers to be keyword-rich. Implement schema markup and other on-page SEO techniques to enhance search engine visibility. Technical SEO: Collaborate with the development team to ensure the website's technical infrastructure is SEO-friendly. Monitor website performance, address crawl issues, and improve site speed. Skills: HTML/CSS, Basic Javascript, WordPress, common Ecommerce CMS (Shopify, BigCommerce, Magento etc.), Google Analytics (Goals, Attribution, Funnels), Google Tag Manager, Office Suites (Slides/PowerPoint, Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel), SEMrush, BrightLocal, Ahrefs, etc. Content Strategy: Develop and execute a content strategy aligned with SEO goals, covering product descriptions, blog posts, and other relevant content. Optimize content for search engines and user experience. Link Building: Execute effective link-building strategies to increase the authority and credibility of the online store. Identify and pursue relevant opportunities for backlink acquisition. SEO Data Analysis and Reporting: Use analytics tools to track and analyze key performance indicators, providing regular reports on SEO performance. Identify areas for improvement and adjust strategies accordingly. Stay Informed on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of industry changes, search engine algorithms, and emerging SEO trends. Apply new knowledge to continually improve the client’s business site's SEO performance. Sales/Product Reporting & Analysis: Ensure data accuracy, organization, and timely reporting. Generate daily reports on sales, profit margins, and product performance. Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis. The Strategist’s main KPI is Managed Revenue, defined as the revenue paid to Rocket Clicks by clients for Organic Search services, shared among the participating team members. Each Strategist is expected to manage $30,000 in revenue. The exact Managed Revenue expectations will fluctuate due to company conditions and will be visible and communicated regularly to the Strategist. The ideal candidate is not only a passionate, independent, and confident digital marketing expert with an emphasis in SEO but also has excellent people skills and can effectively discuss digital strategies from the perspective of a growth-minded business owner. If you are ready to make a significant impact in the world of Search Engine Optimization and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we invite you to apply. Join us and be a crucial part of a team dedicated to achieving unparalleled success online. About Rocket Clicks Who We Are Founded in 2008, our Milwaukee-area Paid and SEO agency has worked with some of the brightest, most agile minds in digital marketing - team members and partners, alike! Each of us brings unique skills and experiences to the table, and we have seen time and time again how the diverse experiences of our team members - both personal and professional - propel us forward and allow us to provide continuously groundbreaking insights. Rocket Clicks is a team in the truest sense of the word. We share knowledge freely and have no hidden agendas. Within our walls you'll hear the word "friend" used more often than "coworker," and we understand that collaboration is at the core of our success. Our Values In Action It's one thing for us to say who we are and what we do. It's another thing to carry through on these promises. Our team is always staying on top of the latest developments in search engine marketing. It’s how we stay sharp. But we don't just horde this information - you can check out our analysis of the most important industry news and deliver informed insights on our blog. We also curate the most important industry news as it happens on our Twitter feed. We talk a lot about our awesome culture, passion for giving back to our community, and celebration of team achievements. We always love to get feedback on what we've been up to, your opinions on the news of the day, and your questions for our staff about what's going on in the rapidly refreshing world of Internet marketing. Why We Work We love to help businesses thrive online via smart, ethical search marketing. We strive to enrich the lives and livelihoods of our partners and our staff, and we deliver real, quantifiable results. We employ leaders at all levels of our company. No university teaches what we know. Raw talent needs training, and in our subtle yet complex industry, training has to be well-informed and unending. Curiosity and reaching are core values. Every time innovation shuffles the deck, we know it is an opportunity to distance our partners from the competition. We stand shoulder to shoulder with partners who are leaders and winners within their industries. Show more Show less

Source and speak to the most exciting b2b software start-ups across North America. Detail : Headline is hiring an investor who will be supporting our early and growth investment teams by sourcing and speaking to the most promising start-ups to help us determine their fit as investment prospects for Headline. The individual we are looking for will specifically focus on b2b software. Location : Bay Area. Time Requirement : Full-time, the investor will manage their own schedule in pacific time zone. Tasks And Role Expectations : Speak to and build trust with 25+ CEOs from exciting North American start-ups each week. Synthesize call notes and key takeaways from conversations with founders. Summarize most compelling opportunities and report these to team members focused on fintech. Build a network in the start-up and venture capital ecosystem and maintain relationships with relevant founders. Undertake market research for Headline investment areas within b2b software. Benefits : This role will present the candidate with a unique opportunity to build extensive tacit knowledge and domain expertise and be a key member of the fintech team after talking with hundreds of founders. Naturally build a network with up-and-coming entrepreneurs in North America. Jumpstart a career in start-ups, tech, or venture capital. Join an experienced team with a flat hierarchy. Job Requirements : Excellent conversation and people skills. One year practical experience in start-ups or tech, fintech knowledge preferred. Enthusiasm for venture and startups. About Headline: Headline (www.headline.com) is a global venture capital firm with dedicated funds and teams in the US, Europe, Asia, and South America. We’ve backed the Founders behind global category creators in b2b software, such as Segment, Appfolio, SEMRush, GoToMeeting, and NGINX, alongside other leading companies, such as Acorns, Sonos, Bumble, Scopely, GoPuff, The RealReal, and Farfetch. About Headline: Headline (fka e.ventures) is a global venture capital firm with dedicated funds and teams in the US, Europe, Asia, and South America. We’ve backed the Founders behind category creators such as Bird, Sonos, Angie’s List, NGINX, AppAnnie, Segment, Acorns, Shipt, Scopely, Farfetch, SoRare, Grin, and Groupon. Show more Show less

Phoenix Support Services, established in 2019 and located in the Philippines, is the in-house support center of Advanced Digital Media Services—a startup full-service digital marketing company in the US. Our company encourages a healthy work-life balance through a remote work setup and provides limitless opportunities for career advancement. Job Description This is a remote position."More than just a job, we offer an opportunity to grow. Come and be part of our growing team!" Leading by #PuttingPeopleFirst, Phoenix Support Services is the in-house support center of Advanced Digital Media Services, a full-service digital marketing company in Florida and Colorado, United States. Located in the Philippines, we engage and delight our customers through years of industry expertise. We are looking for an SEO Manager who is a self-starter, thrives in fast-paced environments, thinks outside the box, is a problem solver, and is looking for ownership over evolving and meaningful projects within a cutting-edge digital marketing agency. This role provides an excellent opportunity to take your SEO career to the next level. Responsibilities And Duties Generally, the SEO Manager will take the lead in managing our SEO department and providing the company with a clear-cut direction on the direction we need to take to provide our clients the best results possible that will help them grow their business. They should be on top of research, ensuring that our decision-making and overall strategy are data-driven and backed by research. Specifically, the SEO Manager ,along with the team members in place, shall manage the following: Keyword Research Perform keyword research, including discovery, expansion, and optimization of keyword opportunities to drive the most valuable traffic. Work with the content and web development teams to implement SEO best practices properly. Link Building Reach out to bloggers and website owners and obtain high-quality links through article contributions. Secure high DA backlinks for our client's websites. Contact and build relationships with other websites and blog owners. Perform and track outreach through social media, email, and phone. Local SEO Implement white hat Local SEO strategies to improve Google search performance. Build Local SEO strategies through structured and unstructured citations, including directories, rich media citations (photo and video), social citations, etc. Perform directory submissions manually and through local citation platforms like BrightLocal and Yext. Requirements Must have a minimum of three years of solid SEO management experience The most recent work employment must be SEO-related Knowledge of BrightLocal, AHREFS, SemRush, etc. Exceptional attention to details Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills A Previous Leadership Role Is Preferred But Not Required Must be amenable to working on flexible work schedules (EST and MST time zones) System Requirements Must have his own Laptop/PC device Minimum of 20 MBPS Internet Connection What Makes Support Phoenix Services Great We are not here today without our exceptional employees. Phoenix Support Services encourages career development by providing employees free access to various training courses, which help them level up professionally and as individuals. Our employees work in a remote work setup with flexible working hours, annual performance appraisals, birthday cakes, anniversary bonuses, and many others. Serving A Mission Greater Than Us Like many successful companies, we at Phoenix Support Services believe in giving back to the community. The organization started when the CEO met her wife, who graduated from the Sisters of Mary School, and if it weren't for her attending the school, they would not have met. The Sisters of Mary take on a yearly mission to help those in need—traveling far and wide, they seek out the most disadvantaged children and use interviews and testing to determine who would benefit from access to their educational programs. The children reside on campus the entire school year while being provided a high-quality education and vocational courses that will serve as a bridge of opportunity to the children in need. No one at the Sisters of Mary School earns a salary. The work is all done voluntarily by the nuns. That is why we are helping them maintain their selfless act through donations from the company's earnings. To learn more about what we do and how to donate, please follow the below links: Role Along with your CV, kindly submit a short application letter providing our Recruitment Team a snapshot of why you are qualified for this specific role and answering the following questions: How do you keep yourself updated with the latest trends in the SEO industry? Staying ahead of the curve is no small feat for SEO professionals in a world where advances in AI technology are disrupting existing business models. How can SEO professionals stay abreast of these new opportunities and challenges to remain competitive? Kindly attach or provide a link to your portfolio. Also, please specify your salary expectation. #J-18808-Ljbffr Show more Show less

This is a remote position. Do you want to be a Chief Marketing Officer? With the right amount of grit and perseverance, you can become one within months (not years) of completing your MBA. If you have a background in marketing and want to lead marketing teams while training to become a B2B SaaS marketing executive, you’ve come to the right place. The agency is expanding. They’re hiring ambitious, talented MBA marketers who want to get their hands dirty and rapidly grow their careers. This is a rare opportunity to become an expert in B2B SaaS marketing while leading startup marketing teams in their journeys toward exponential growth. This agency focuses on B2B SaaS startups, building and managing their marketing functions and guiding them through go-to-market strategy, positioning, customer segmentation, building marketing teams, and all other marketing-related tasks. The role will start with up to six months of on-the-job training as you shadow an experienced fractional CMO. You will work with clients, learn the consultative process and gain an understanding of the standard of work that is expected. Moreso, you will be the CMO’s right hand, with the ultimate goal of replacing them as a marketing leader for their client. Following this period, you will take point servicing their clients as their marketing leader, working hands-on with early-stage startups to launch their products, get them to product-market fit, grow ARR, and optimize CAC/cost to service in creative ways. All hires will participate in a "probationary period" to train employees and determine if the role is a good fit. The probationary period is 3 to 6 months, depending on performance. This position is remote. Timezone will depend on the clients you’re working with; however, you will mostly work with team members on both EST and PST. Employees receive unlimited vacation. Employees should expect to work an average of 50-60 hours per week. Responsibilities In this role, you will: Lead the marketing team for up to two of our clients at a time. Move clients from MVP to PMF and exponential growth. Drive positioning, segmentation & messaging. Own product pricing, go-to-market, and launch strategy. Optimize and improve clients’ online presence. Build channel partnerships and referral campaigns. Develop branding, PR programs, and trademarks. Lead content marketing & thought leadership. Manage both organic and paid search and social campaigns. Hire and onboard clients’ first marketing teams. Manage & coach internal marketing team members, including new Associate CMOs and marketing associates. Determine clients' growth goals, GTM channels, ICP, and messaging & positioning. Take ownership of demand generation and pipeline creation, meeting monthly and quarterly MQL & pipeline targets. Measure and act on SaaS funnel metrics, including CAC, LTV, payback period, etc Manage campaign performance across paid search, paid social, and third-party lead gen platforms. Measure, analyze, and report campaign performance to clients’ leadership teams. Work with clients to plan, promote and leverage events, trade shows, and webinars with attributable results. Have a deep understanding of marketing automation systems. HubSpot knowledge is a big plus. Productize their services to constantly improve and scale further. Requirements What we’re looking for Working with this agency team means embracing self-improvement. They don’t expect perfection, but they need a candidate with attention to detail, endless curiosity, humility, and the desire to level up fast. They own their work by seeking responsibility and accountability for the ideas they create. They ask "Why?" a lot and share their goals and experiences to challenge their thinking. Proficiency in using SEO tools, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, or similar platforms. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex SEO concepts to clients and internal teams. Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. Tremendous is the fast, free, flexible way to send bulk payouts to people in over 200 countries. 10,000+ companies ranging from mom-and-pops to Google, MIT, and United Way have sent over $1 billion, saving 15 hours a month on average. In both our product and our workplace, we’re intentional about making work more efficient, flexible, and fulfilling. Tremendous is a fully remote, high-documentation, low-meeting culture, which means more time for what matters in both your professional and personal life. Our customers, who include marketers, UX researchers, HR teams and nonprofits, rave about how quick and easy it is to use Tremendous — check the ratings on G2. Yet there’s a lot of complexity under the hood, including over 2,000 redemption options and plenty of banking infrastructure. This duality makes working here a fun challenge. We’re about 90 people, highly profitable without any investors, and have been doubling our revenue for a few years and counting. Join us before the next international offsite! About The Role You will be responsible for optimizing our customer journey by ensuring our website is optimized to maximize conversions (both product-led and sales-assisted) and traffic. You will work closely with cross-functional partners like our product, design, content and engineering teams to execute technical SEO improvements, content optimizations, and website experiments. You will analyze website analytics and share updates on website performance and trends with the marketing org and leadership team. You will Identify and prioritize opportunities to drive organic growth and execute roadmap in partnership with PMM, Content, Product, and Engineering teams. Identify content gaps in our website strategy to enhance user experience and drive traffic and conversions Conduct keyword research to guide the content team Review technical SEO issues and collaborate with engineering team to implement solutions Drive off-page optimization projects such as link-building Improve structured data, linking, taxonomy on our website Partner with the Product team to build and prioritize a website experimentation roadmap to increase lead volume Ensure the website is optimized for best practices for performance around CTA, forms, layout, content, etc. Use web analytics platforms to gather customer journey insights from user behavior, as well as track and report on website performance (organic traffic trends, rankings, conversion rate, speed, etc) Prioritize and project manage website requests from the marketing team You have 5+ years of experience in marketing, SEO, conversion rate optimization, and building customer journeys Knowledge of SEO best practices (including technical SEO, on-page, and off-page) Track record of delivering and communicating business impact from SEO investments Experience with relevant tools (Moz, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, etc) Experience working cross-functionally with engineering, design, product, content, and product marketing teams Strong project management skills Bonus: Experience with conversion rate optimization and running website experiments What’s Cool About The Role You'll get to work with a top-notch team at Tremendous. You'll work at a company growing quickly yet sustainably. We’re profitable with plenty more opportunity ahead. That’s good news for your career growth. Competitive pay, equity and benefits. The base salary for this role is $140,000 - $180,000. We're a remote company. Work from wherever you want in the Americas — we have collaboration hours from around 12-4 PM Eastern time. Compensation Range: $140K - $180K Show more Show less

Reports To: VP, Digital Audience Location: New York City Salary: $90,000-$100,000 This is a full-time Hybrid position (3 days in the office) offering a competitive salary, healthcare, and a benefits package. a360media is a multi-platform media company and publisher. Our media portfolio includes well-known Celebrity & Entertainment and Women's Lifestyle brands such as Us Weekly, InTouch, Life & Style, Closer, Soap Opera Digest, and Women’s World. Outside of being one of the most successful publishers at newsstand, our brands are rapidly growing across digital channels, reaching more than 42MM+ unique views each month and 27MM+ social media fans through high-quality content. Are you obsessed with pop-culture and entertainment? Join our team! We are seeking a Sr. SEO Manager for our entertainment brands (Us Weekly, InTouch and Life & Style). As a Senior SEO Manager at a360media, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our digital footprint and driving organic search performance. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to implement effective SEO strategies, analyze data, and stay up-to-date with industry trends to ensure our online visibility and search rankings are consistently optimized. You will have the opportunity to establish best-in-class SEO operations to drive digital audience growth and acquisition from organic search channels. The ideal candidate is a SEO subject matter expert who has experience leading content strategy at a major media brand or publisher. In this role, you will elevate and expand the search presence of well-regarded media titles. You must be a savvy self-starter who loves building from the ground up, leverages data and has excellent communication skills. Core Responsibilities Develop long and short-term strategic roadmaps for organic search. Ensure alignment with key partners across digital and content teams. Maintain a set of Standard SEO Requirements and ensure they are followed by editors. Develop processes and communications to evaluate if content matches user intent. Conduct thorough keyword research to identify valuable opportunities and optimize existing content for targeted keywords. Keeps a pulse on the entertainment industry to identify trends and opportunities. Partner with other digital marketing channels to identify synergies and optimization opportunities that lead to increases in incremental traffic and conversion. Monitor and analyze website performance using SEO tools and platforms, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve results across Google properties (Search, Discover, News) Subject matter expertise in SEO. Stay current with industry trends, algorithm updates, and best practices to adjust strategies accordingly. Work with external agencies and consultants on comprehensive audits of our entertainment brands (Us Weekly, Life & Style, InTouch) to identify shortcomings/opportunities (site speed, internal linking,information architecture, etc.). Create a plan and roadmap to address results of audits. Conduct deep-dives and audits into topical focus areas. Provide clear takeaways and direction to the content team. Work closely with content and product teams to implement on-page and technical SEO recommendations, ensuring optimal website performance. Utilize data-driven insights to create detailed analytics reports on SEO performance, highlighting progress and areas for improvement. Support technical SEO (page indexing, site structure, crawling) as needed including QA. Clearly able to articulate the priority and importance of SEO to internal groups. Act as an SEO evangelist internally across functions to ensure we have the right foundations for content & products. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience as an SEO Manager with 3-5 years of experience and a track record of driving organic growth for a news media publisher. Strong understanding of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO best practices. Able to clearly articulate business results from SEO investments using data. Experience with content management systems (CMS) and website platforms to implement SEO recommendations effectively. Job Title and Description: Search Engine Optimization Strategist About The Job Are you a dynamic and results-driven SEO professional with a passion for maximizing online visibility and revenue? We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated SEO Strategist to join our team. As a key player, you will be responsible for driving organic traffic, enhancing search engine rankings, and optimizing our client's business to achieve unparalleled success. What We Offer Basic Salary ranges from $71K to $100K (negotiable based on experience). Bonus: Earn up to $2,500 per quarter. Benefits: 401(k) with matching Dental Insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Vision insurance Qualifications Required 3+ years of experience in digital marketing with an emphasis on SEO Minimum of 1 year SEO experience with on-site optimization and copywriting A clear understanding of how SEO fits into a larger online marketing strategy and interacts with other marketing tactics Experience managing 4+ client relationships simultaneously Stellar written and verbal communication skills shown in navigating emotionally charged conversations, creating clarity in emails, creating meaningful dialogue during presentations, etc. Preferred Relevant Certifications: Google Analytics Prior experience with Lead Generation and E-Commerce businesses Responsibilities Keyword Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive keyword research to identify high-value and relevant keywords for product pages. Analyze competitor keywords and industry trends to stay ahead of the curve. On-Page Optimization: Optimize product pages for search engines, strategically placing content, meta tags, and headers to be keyword-rich. Implement schema markup and other on-page SEO techniques to enhance search engine visibility. Technical SEO: Collaborate with the development team to ensure the website's technical infrastructure is SEO-friendly. Monitor website performance, address crawl issues, and improve site speed. Skills: HTML/CSS, Basic Javascript, WordPress, common Ecommerce CMS (Shopify, BigCommerce, Magento etc.), Google Analytics (Goals, Attribution, Funnels), Google Tag Manager, Office Suites (Slides/PowerPoint, Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel), SEMrush, BrightLocal, Ahrefs, etc. Content Strategy: Develop and execute a content strategy aligned with SEO goals, covering product descriptions, blog posts, and other relevant content. Optimize content for search engines and user experience. Link Building: Execute effective link-building strategies to increase the authority and credibility of the online store. Identify and pursue relevant opportunities for backlink acquisition. SEO Data Analysis and Reporting: Use analytics tools to track and analyze key performance indicators, providing regular reports on SEO performance. Identify areas for improvement and adjust strategies accordingly. Stay Informed on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of industry changes, search engine algorithms, and emerging SEO trends. Apply new knowledge to continually improve the client’s business site's SEO performance. Sales/Product Reporting & Analysis: Ensure data accuracy, organization, and timely reporting. Generate daily reports on sales, profit margins, and product performance. Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis. The Strategist’s main KPI is Managed Revenue, defined as the revenue paid to Rocket Clicks by clients for Organic Search services, shared among the participating team members. Each Strategist is expected to manage $30,000 in revenue. The exact Managed Revenue expectations will fluctuate due to company conditions and will be visible and communicated regularly to the Strategist. The ideal candidate is not only a passionate, independent, and confident digital marketing expert with an emphasis in SEO but also has excellent people skills and can effectively discuss digital strategies from the perspective of a growth-minded business owner. If you are ready to make a significant impact in the world of Search Engine Optimization and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we invite you to apply. Join us and be a crucial part of a team dedicated to achieving unparalleled success online. About Rocket Clicks Who We Are Founded in 2008, our Milwaukee-area Paid and SEO agency has worked with some of the brightest, most agile minds in digital marketing - team members and partners, alike! Each of us brings unique skills and experiences to the table, and we have seen time and time again how the diverse experiences of our team members - both personal and professional - propel us forward and allow us to provide continuously groundbreaking insights. Rocket Clicks is a team in the truest sense of the word. We share knowledge freely and have no hidden agendas. Within our walls you'll hear the word "friend" used more often than "coworker," and we understand that collaboration is at the core of our success. Our Values In Action It's one thing for us to say who we are and what we do. It's another thing to carry through on these promises. Our team is always staying on top of the latest developments in search engine marketing. It’s how we stay sharp. But we don't just horde this information - you can check out our analysis of the most important industry news and deliver informed insights on our blog. We also curate the most important industry news as it happens on our Twitter feed. We talk a lot about our awesome culture, passion for giving back to our community, and celebration of team achievements. We always love to get feedback on what we've been up to, your opinions on the news of the day, and your questions for our staff about what's going on in the rapidly refreshing world of Internet marketing. Why We Work We love to help businesses thrive online via smart, ethical search marketing. We strive to enrich the lives and livelihoods of our partners and our staff, and we deliver real, quantifiable results. We employ leaders at all levels of our company. No university teaches what we know. Raw talent needs training, and in our subtle yet complex industry, training has to be well-informed and unending. Curiosity and reaching are core values. Every time innovation shuffles the deck, we know it is an opportunity to distance our partners from the competition. We stand shoulder to shoulder with partners who are leaders and winners within their industries. Show more Show less

job_title: Remote Paid Search Specialist (PPC) - Hawaii (HST Hours)
job_summary: This is a remote role open only to candidates in Hawaii. Relocation assistance will not be provided. To view our open roles in other states, click here. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish, and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group set up Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports into the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns - optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google: Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, gMail Basic Knowledge in or experience with similar tools such as: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu, or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous To learn more about Brafton, CHECK US OUT HERE Benefits Include: Health, Dental, Vision, Colonial Life, 401k with Match, Paid Time Off, remote work perks and more! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training. We are looking for someone who is detail-oriented to bring their in-depth expertise across search, social and programmatic to our fun and crazy talented marketing team! A wizard, of sorts – with magical powers in everything…like strong analytical skills, critical thinking ability, and proven performance in leveraging data to make intelligent, actionable business decisions – just to name a few. So Is Leveraging All Those Cool Acronyms We Like To Use Into Tangible, Successful Results. You’ll Also Need To Be Seasoned In a Few Things For This Position. About First Insight 💡 First Insight is the global leader in Voice of the Customer retail solutions, transforming business decision-making and business performance through actionable consumer insights and AI. Our platform enables retailers and brands to boost revenues and profitability by informing strategic decisions with insightful consumer data and removing guesswork. Trusted by hundreds of leading retailers, vertically integrated brands, mass merchants, and wholesalers, First Insight leads in optimizing strategy, planning, product, pricing, and marketing decisions. From Concept to Conversion, First Insight provides a powerful, scalable, and easy-to-integrate solution that informs all the go-to-market business decisions you face. Through advanced analytics, First Insight’s platform represents a proven, breakthrough solution with a better signal and actionable data to help decision makers confidently anticipate outcomes so businesses can build financial plans that they can achieve. At First Insight (FI) we are all about the ultimate outcome – the delivery of measurable results to our customers. Our innovative solutions leveraging consumer data, AI and advanced predictive analytics have taken the retail sector by storm, resulting in years of consistent, significant growth. We are seeking a high performance, self-motivated, professional looking for an opportunity to help drive our business as a Demand Generation Manager. The DGM will drive the digital enablement of a modern and powerful demand generation and revenue retention operation at First Insight. RESPONSIBILITIES : The Demand Generation Manager will spearhead the company's lead generation and sales enhancement strategies, with a focus on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) utilizing an omni-channel approach. This role demands expertise in Google AdWords, SEMRush for SEO and SEM, and proficient use of HubSpot for sales and marketing operations. The manager will also be responsible for collaborating with content creation teams, leveraging event marketing, and staying at the forefront of technological advancements in digital marketing. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute ABM campaigns across various channels like direct mail, email, phone, LinkedIn/Dipify, and SalesNavigator. Manage email marketing campaigns, focusing on impactful content and design. Drive demand generation strategies to maximize lead acquisition and sales conversions. Oversee sales operations to align with marketing strategies and business goals. Expertly handle HubSpot operations for CRM and marketing automation. Utilize Google AdWords for targeted advertising and lead generation. Employ SEMRush for advanced SEO and SEM strategies. Work closely with content creation teams to develop targeted content supporting ABM and SEO/SEM initiatives. Leverage event marketing, including webinars and conferences, as part of the demand generation strategy. Stay updated with the latest trends in demand generation, ABM, and digital marketing. Embrace new technologies and innovative approaches in digital marketing. Apply analytics to guide marketing operations and optimize campaign performance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams for cohesive marketing and sales efforts. Requirements: Proven experience in demand generation, ABM, and sales operations, preferably in a B2B environment. Ideally with software/technology providers or clients. Proficiency in HubSpot, Google AdWords, and SEMRush. Experience in omnichannel ABM campaigns and email marketing. Collaboration skills for working with content teams and event marketing. Strong analytical skills for data-driven decision-making. Excellent communication and leadership abilities. Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field. Authorization to work in the United States. Willingness to travel regularly to the headquarters in Pittsburgh, PA. Company Policy/Procedure Compliance The Demand Generation Manager will be obligated to comply with all company policies and procedures including, but not limited to, any Agreements that the company may enter into, in addition to complying with other Human Resources requirements. In discharging the duties of this position, the DGM may come into contact with confidential patent identifiable or other sensitive information and will be obligated to maintain strict confidentiality of this information and report any breach immediately to the CFO and CEO. Look us up! Benefits & Perks First Insight offers a competitive salary; paid employee healthcare coverage; a 401(k) with company match; employer-paid life and long-term disability insurance; and a generous Paid Time Off (PTO) package including paid holidays and sick days and a positive team environment. U.S. News & World Report is a multifaceted digital media company dedicated to helping citizens, consumers, business leaders and policy officials make important decisions in their lives. We publish independent reporting, rankings, data journalism and advice that has earned the trust of our readers and users for nearly 90 years. Our platforms on usnews.com include Education, Health, Money, Travel, Cars, News and 360 Reviews. We reach more than 40 million people monthly during moments when they are most in need of expert advice and motivated to act on that advice directly on our platforms. Our signature franchises include our “Best” series of consumer guides on colleges, graduate schools, hospitals, diets, cars, financial services and more. These guides provide an easy-to-digest list for consumers to better understand and compare when making their decisions. We continue to publish annual guides of the authoritative Best Colleges and Best Hospitals rankings on our website and in print. And our U.S. News Live flagship conferences highlight important national conversations including Healthcare of Tomorrow and Healthiest Communities. We believe in having a broad range of talent and backgrounds at U.S. News. We strive to maintain a welcoming workplace where everyone is given an opportunity to succeed and contribute to their fullest. Learn more about our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiative. Your role in helping us shape the future: As a member of U.S. News, you will be involved in implementing our SEO strategy for traffic growth that helps drive the future of our business. You will be a key member of a fast-growing organization that is goal-oriented and re-shaping our future. The primary responsibilities of the SEO Analyst will be to champion our organic traffic growth through smart, actionable search tactics and work closely with the U.S. News global SEO team to create the future SEO strategy for the U.S. News site. Company Description At Marketplace, our mission is to help readers turn their aspirations into reality. We arm people with trusted advice and guidance, so they can make informed decisions they feel confident in and get back to doing the things they care about most. We are an experienced team of industry experts dedicated to helping readers make smart decisions and choose the right products with ease. Marketplace boasts decades of experience across dozens of geographies and teams, including Content, SEO, Business Intelligence, Finance, HR, Marketing, Production, Technology and Sales. The team brings rich industry knowledge to Marketplace’s global coverage of consumer credit, debt, health, home improvement, banking, investing, credit cards, small business, education, insurance, loans, real estate and travel. Job Description We are seeking a talented individual to come to help Forbes Marketplace grow our offering in the US for financial services information and advice to consumers. We need you to help take us to the next level. We have big aspirations, and you’ll have all the tools and resources needed at your disposal to make us the #1 organic site for the following financial services verticals: Credit Cards and Travel Rewards. Experience with data analysis – you’re very data-oriented and able to use data to support the strategies you pitch to implement on site You’ve used SEO tools like Ahrefs, SEMRush, GSC, and Google Analytics Working knowledge of technical SEO elements such as schema, canonicals and site speed Have a passion for continued learning and staying up to date on industry news Highly organized, with very strong attention to detail Skilled in time management and working autonomously – you’re able to take action where and when needed (based on data analysis) without requiring specific instruction Knowledge and experience with WordPress and other CMS Experience within the finance industry, and preferably in credit cards and travel reward Team player with a positive attitude Benefits: Competitive compensation package Ability to work remotely Unlimited PTO Every third Friday of the month off Winter break closure; the week between Christmas and New Years Home office setup Wellness Reimbursement Additional Information Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. SEO Manager An award-winning digital marketing agency has an immediate opening for an SEO Manager . As SEO Manager, you would be responsible for the service and management of a diverse portfolio of organic marketing programs for multiple high-profile accounts. As an agency, Gen3 Marketing provides clients with “white hat” SEO solutions that keep their website(s) in alignment with Google’s best practices for online content. Our recommendations often improve both user and search engine crawler experience, which in turn benefit our clients’ website performance. Our mission is to identify opportunities and apply optimizations that users and search engines prefer, enabling our clients to grow their online business and make the most of web traffic from all channels. Requirements & Responsibilities: Supporting strategy, planning, and analysis for client on-site and off-site SEO campaigns. Proficiently managing time and prioritizing tasks to meet monthly service allocations, demonstrating flexibility within set timelines while collaborating effectively within a team-oriented environment. Adaptively understanding client needs, crafting bespoke solutions that align with their objectives. This involves attentive listening, anticipating perspectives, and delivering targeted strategies. Conducting keyword and competitor research to support actionable recommendations. Reviewing opportunities for improving client websites from a technical perspective, including the resolution of errors and optimization of page speed performance. Manually reviewing crawl data to identify and prioritize solutions that will improve the quality and user experience on client websites. Monitoring and reporting on client website performance, including wins and opportunities. Implementing approved SEO recommendations on the behalf of clients. Drafting high-quality, original, well-researched written copy for client marketing campaigns. Editing both internally written and client-provided copy. Vetting potential link partners, drafting scripts, and conducting outreach campaigns to secure paid and organic placements on third-party websites. Publishing approved content and optimizations on the behalf of clients. Formalizing and presenting recommendations to clients for approval. Leveraging third-party tools, such as SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Moz, and Majestic to identify technical, content, and outreach opportunities. Communicating findings and recommendations to clients over the phone, email, and teleconference. Optimizing on-site content, including titles, meta descriptions, internal links, and more. Preferred Experience & Skills: Applicants with intermediate to advanced SEO experience are highly preferred. Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to interpret data, draw conclusions, identify opportunities, and provide succinct recommendations. Hustle and an exceptional work ethic. Exceptional attention to detail. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. A quick study results who’s driven and willing to proactively research solutions. Strong observational and problem-solving skills. Comprehension and the ability/willingness to speak to current industry trends. Self-motivated with the ability to both take direction and work independently with minimal supervision. Interest in creative or technical writing (strong writing samples are a plus). Skill and experience with any of the following tools, platforms, and coding languages are a big plus: Basecamp Clockify Drupal Google Analytics Google Drive (Sheets, Docs, etc.) Google Keyword Planner Google Search Console HTML, CSS, JavaScript Magento Majestic Moz Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) Photoshop Salesforce (Demandware) Screaming Frog SEMrush Shopify WordPress Location: Canada and US locations will be considered except for the following US States:Washington, California, Nevada, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Colorado Connecticut, Maryland, Rhode Island. Benefits: Growth Opportunities within the company The chance to develop your expertise skills, with a creative and high-performing international team Competitive salary Work from home Paid Company Holidays 15 PTO days Show more Show less

iPullRank is an ambitious eight-year-old digital marketing agency based in New York City and founded by industry thought leader Michael King. Our mission is to drive results for our clients by delivering marketing work that we can be PROUD of. Oh, and our value set is PROUD: P – Proactive; R – Reliable; O – Outstanding; U – Useful; D – Dedicated. We keep that front and center on a day-to-day basis. If you’re curious about what types of clients we work with, they range from Fortune 500 brands to mid-sized enterprises and exciting small businesses. Our team executes and consults on campaigns in a variety of industries, but many of our clients tend to be media, finance or fashion companies. The iPullRank team is adept at providing a range of digital marketing services, but most of our work is in some combination of Content Strategy, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Analytics and Conversion Rate Optimization. Our employees are duly encouraged to specialize deeply in a specific category that they are passionate about and grow into well-rounded marketers through collaboration, training and real-world experience. As an employer, we look to cultivate an environment where employees feel taken care of. Despite our size, we offer competitive salaries and benefits. We want our employees to grow with us. We don’t want you to just fill a role, we want you to take ownership and make an impact. We’re not a big agency and our clients appreciate that because our size allows us to make things happen. We’re a nimble group that believes the best idea can come from anyone in the company -- and we're always after the best idea. We’re looking for creative and smart people to join our team and help us in our missions to find the best idea. If that’s you, we’d love to hear from you. Position Description iPullRank is looking for an Digital Marketing Associate to join our team. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and support site auditing, keyword and persona research, content strategy, competitive analysis, link building, content marketing and client reporting. We are looking for someone who has an interest in and some level of experience in SEO who can also support content strategy initiatives. The Digital Marketing Associate will work with the SEO and Content Strategy teams to identify causes of changes in clients’ websites’ organic search performance and, through research and ideation, help develop programs that will improve conversion of organic traffic. Range for this position is $45,000-$50,000 with an assessment at 3 months. Company Introduction: Get Visible is an agile multi-service digital marketing agency with a full suite of services to help our clients get more visible online, acquire more leads, and take their revenue to new heights. Since 2005, we have collaborated with clients to fill their pipeline with better customers by providing them with eye-catching websites, better search engine and social media visibility, and an industry-leading reputation. From our headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona, our 15-person team of innovators collaborates with clients in multiple states. In 18 years, we’ve built over 200 websites, reached over 5000 first-page rankings, and achieved a 345% increase in quality leads for our clients. Our years of experience, client-centric approach, and unwavering tenacity are why our clients stick with us. That’s why we’ve been a 5-star Google-rated agency since the beginning. Our team is not just an ally for our clients. We’re their secret weapon, armed with a battle-tested set of strategies and systems to deliver the best results possible. That’s why investing in our team is a big part of our success recipe. Our relentless culture of tech innovation doesn’t just keep us on our toes. It makes us the nimble ninjas of the digital marketing world, always one step ahead of the curve. Are you ready to join our dynamic team? About The Role Our SEO Expert is responsible for developing, implementing, and managing search engine optimization (SEO) strategies for our clients to improve their online presence, generate more leads, and increase the effectiveness of their digital footprint. This position requires a deep understanding of SEO and digital marketing best practices, a client-centric mindset, and excellent problem-solving abilities to ensure our clients' content is optimized and easily findable online. In addition, it requires excellent leadership skills as this role will involve coordinating with our SEO Team to make sure they’re delivering the best results for our clients. In this senior role, you will be at the forefront of ensuring that all our SEO services are delivered in a timely manner and without error in order to uphold our mission of delivering impactful results to our clients. Responsibilities generally include managing client accounts and strategies, ensuring that the right content is put in front of the right people at the right time, working to improve and optimize all SEO campaigns and initiatives for our clients, and continuously reviewing all accounts to spot, predict, and solve any areas of danger where problems could arise. You will also need to run regular status reports and identify areas for growth and improvement within our SEO service environment. Mission statement: The primary mission of our SEO Expert is to continuously review strategies and provide SEO results that are desired by the client in a timely fashion. This includes being able to deliver high-quality work, solve simple and complex SEO problems faced by our clients, and continuously optimize the strategy for every account. On top of that, you will need to take a very proactive approach to ensure that all SEO-related problems are solved before the client is even aware of them. General responsibilities: The responsibilities of our SEO Expert include, but are not limited to: Working alongside our team of SEO Experts towards achieving and exceeding performance targets, ensuring that every client’s content is optimized, functional, and monitored consistently Playing an active role in our team of SEO Experts by handling more complex SEO-related problems and larger client accounts Regularly meeting with our team of SEO experts to review the work done on our client accounts Taking ownership of the quality and efficiency of our SEO service processes and policies, and working to optimize them and resolve issues when needed Developing and implementing robust and highly effective SEO strategies that align with the client’s objectives and that will increase their online visibility and return on investment Working to implement on-page and off-page SEO tactics to maximize content effectiveness Collaborating with other team members to optimize our clients’ digital footprint to improve their search engine visibility and rankings, as well as increase their organic traffic and leads Adopting a client-centric mindset, working to understand client goals, and tailoring SEO strategies to suit the niche, needs, and specific requirements of every client account Running regular status reports, conducting comprehensive SEO audits, and continuously reviewing all accounts to spot, predict, and solve any areas of danger where potential SEO-related problems could arise Continuously conducting research into current SEO trends, algorithm changes for major search engines, emerging SEO best practices, keyword strategies, and more Working to identify challenges and inefficiencies within existing SEO strategies and implement effective solutions to bring the best results for our clients Overall, the SEO Expert will play a pivotal role in managing, developing, improving, and monitoring the SEO solutions we provide our clients to give them the best results possible. Position specifications: The SEO Expert position includes committing to the following: Full-time commitment while meeting our availability for our office hours 40-hour work week (Monday - Friday 8:30 am - 5 pm MST) Fixed-rate monthly salary paid in USD Receive contractor status after signing our non-disclosure agreement Committing to a 30-day notice period after the first month Receive onboarding training of approximately 2-4 weeks Receiving paid days off in accordance with our Leave Policy and Public Holidays Policy Requirements About You: Profile: The SEO Expert needs to take a highly communicative, effective, and proactive approach to their work. You should be able to work independently with high levels of reliability, transparency, and trust. You also need the ability to work under pressure. The ideal person for this role is a rational thinker, enjoys problem-solving, and has excellent communication skills. In addition, good organizational, time management, and analytical skills will help you succeed in this position. The ideal candidate is not just an SEO Expert but also a strategic and out-of-the-box thinker who can easily navigate the complex digital landscape. You should also feel comfortable working in a remote environment. Availability and consistency are highly important factors for us, so our SEO Expert should display these qualities when it comes to workload commitments and general availability during office hours. Key traits for this position: Showing great attention to detail, being organized and structured, being both processes and big-picture-oriented, possessing good communication and interpersonal skills, being highly analytical and a team player, and having a grasp of current trends and best practices in the digital marketing industry. A sense of proactivity, hunger for growth, and a great work ethic will work in your favor. You will also need a forward-thinking approach to anticipate shifts in search engine algorithms and industry trends, and you should have a client-centric mindset that can adapt and evolve with the digital landscape. Key requirements: The SEO Expert position has the following key requirements: At least 3 years of working experience in an SEO agency or as a freelancer Previous experience in a senior role within the digital marketing and SEO industry General knowledge of SEO software such as CORA, SEMRush, Screaming Frog, Surfer, etc. Previous experience in providing SEO-related services to clients in the United States A deep understanding of SEO trends, best practices, and core principles Comfortable speaking & explaining industry terms to clients on face-to-face Zoom calls An ability to use different SEO platforms effectively and efficiently Ability to think rationally and make decisions or problem-solve independently Possess a proactive, forward-thinking, and out-of-the-box approach to your work Familiarity with working autonomously and managing your own time independently and effectively Must have a stable internet connection and a laptop or PC, as well as be able to attend virtual video conferences Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. You must be fluent in English, although English doesn't have to be your native language Being open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism and improving on it, as well as giving feedback of a similar nature productively to your team Must be available and responsive during our office hours Must be able to work full-time consistently Show more Show less

About the Role Stacksphere is a leading provider of B2B Tech & Services information, serving small- to mid-market businesses with our suite of channels for educating buyers and connecting them with top SaaS providers. At Stacksphere, we're thinking bigger and better about how to tackle the B2B Tech opportunity, and we're connecting tech buyers with software vendors more efficiently. We are seeking a Market Research Manager to join our growing team. Reporting to the Chief Content Officer, the Market Research Manager will play a crucial role in shaping our content and market strategies by providing valuable insights into the B2B Tech and Services landscape and providing differentiation through delivering proprietary insights. You will gather, analyze and interpret market data, ensuring that our content remains competitive, relevant and aligned to industry trends. The ideal candidate will have exceptional analytical skills and the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies. Your Day-to-Day Conduct in-depth market research on B2B Tech and services to identify key trends, competitor activities, consumer behavior, and emerging opportunities for growth. Develop comprehensive user personas, incorporating demographics, behaviors, goals, and pain points to represent various segments of the target audience and incorporate into detailed buyer journey maps. Monitor and analyze competitor behavior, product offerings, and marketing strategies to stay ahead in the market. Design and execute surveys, focus groups, 1:1 interviews, and competitor analysis to gather relevant data. Source and engage industry experts for valuable insights. Utilize tools like SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics, Pollfish, SEMrush, Ahrefs, and/or SimilarWeb for effective research and analysis. Generate comprehensive reports and presentations summarizing key findings, insights, and recommendations for senior leadership. Demonstrate an analytical mindset, challenge assumptions, and provide strategic insights. Manage multiple research projects simultaneously, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and timely completion. Proactively identify opportunities and challenges, pitching hypotheses for further research. Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate research findings into business strategies and creative assets. About You Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Marketing, Business, or related field). 3+ years of experience working in market research. B2B experience is a bonus. Proven experience with survey design and analysis tools, including optional certifications in the field. Proficiency in using market research tools such as SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics, Pollfish, SEMrush, Ahrefs, and SimilarWeb. Experience in competitor analysis, focus group moderation, and sourcing industry experts. Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally to manage project plans and keep research objectives "plugged in" to business needs. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Ability to work proactively in a fast-paced and evolving environment. An inherent drive to be excellent: You are not satisfied with average. You do whatever it takes to get the job done at a world-class level. While we're looking for some specific experiences and skill sets, nothing is more important than a strong can-do attitude, resilience in the face of change and uncertainty, and a passion for learning and creating. About Us Stacksphere is a leading provider of B2B Tech & Services information, serving small- to mid-market businesses with our suite of channels for educating buyers and connecting them with top SaaS providers. At Stacksphere, we're thinking bigger and better about how to tackle the B2B Tech opportunity, and we're connecting tech buyers with software vendors more efficiently. Our multi-channel approach builds community and engagement with consumers, setting us apart from the competition. Stacksphere was incubated inside Three Ships, a growth equity firm that launches digital-first businesses. Three Ships is a growth equity firm that launches and invests in digital companies, builds great leadership teams, and helps them rapidly scale. Our portfolio currently includes several businesses - Home Solutions, Pillar 4, Stacksphere, and 3S UK - and over 50+ websites that help consumers navigate the overwhelming choices through online marketplaces and the most informative content online. Headquartered in Raleigh with offices in Charlotte and London, we are always looking to find the right people to help us continue to grow this business and place a high value on teammates with a growth mindset and a "get after it" mentality. Why You Should Join Us Results : At Three Ships we have eleven consecutive years of profitability and a track record of successful growth in the digital marketing space. Stability : We are privately owned, have a holding period of "forever," have no debt, and have significant cash to invest – we're "rock-solid" financially. Exposure : You will have a front-row seat in growing a business. Your teammates have built and sold companies, managed 100s of employees, and run campaigns with Fortune 500 brands. Market Landscape: The digital B2B marketing landscape is transforming. There's no better time than now to be building a business in this space. Career Growth: There is no cap on growth, promotions, or the opportunity to own and put your stamp on important projects. Prove your value and you will be rewarded accordingly. Learning : We are a small and mighty team but also have the advantage of tapping into the Three Ships ecosystem and working with subject matter experts in paid media, creative, branding, content strategy, SEO, and more. The opportunity to grow new skills and learn from smart people is endless. Fun : The team has a high bar for excellence, but also a real interest in each other and making work fun. The Package As a full-time employee of Three Ships, you'll have access to competitive benefits, including flexible time off, health/dental/vision, 401k match, an annual Relax & Recharge Bonus, an annual Learning & Development stipend to enroll in class(es) of your choosing, and up to $75 mobile reimbursement. If you join us in person in our Raleigh or Charlotte locations, we have an office stocked with snacks, coffee, and just about every other beverage you can imagine. This is a remote full-time contract position and is open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group setup Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports to the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns — optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals — within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI-based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience . Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, Gmail Basic Knowledge in or experience with: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and the ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly. Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment. TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous Contractors must provide their own industry hardware and a stable internet connection. Firebrand helps startups crush their marketing goals. We are a specialist PR and marketing firm for tech startups. Based in San Francisco, Firebrand’s integrated public relations, content marketing, demand generation and growth marketing programs help startups outshine their competitors. Our experienced team combines domain expertise, marketing best-practice, operational efficiency and the x-factor to implement winning campaigns. Firebrand was named Boutique agency of the year 2023 from PRSA (Public Relations Society of America). You can expect an entrepreneurial culture, to work directly with a senior team, to be strategic and hands-on, and to help build a fantastic firm. We have no politics, no bureaucracy, efficient systems and a supportive approach. We focus on great work, high levels of client service and expanding our skills. We work with a roster of hand-picked startups that are leaders in their field and backed by prominent VCs including a16z, First Round, GV, Initialized, LightSpeed, Menlo Ventures and Unusual VC. Our clients are technology startups – primarily with complex propositions that need clear positioning and messaging. At present, clients range from ‘deep tech’ – data analytics, AI/ML, storage, cloud infrastructure, cybersecurity – to fintech, health tech and climate tech. About The Role We’re looking for a Senior Account Executive , specializing in PPC and SEO , with B2B agency experience managing clients and executing sound strategies to consistently deliver results. You will bring superb writing skills, technical know-how, an analytical approach, and creativity to create great paid media and SEO programs for highly technical products and services. You'll help drive the SEM/SEO roadmap and be responsible for campaign implementation, measurement and collaborating with clients to prove efforts are successful and scalable. Most of our campaigns are integrated across PR, content marketing, demand gen and digital marketing so you’ll get plenty of exposure to other disciplines. PPC / Paid Media Expectations: We expect you to have a strong grasp of running successful paid media campaigns across the main platforms (Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, LinkedIn, X [Twitter], Meta), some experience with account-based marketing strategies (ABM) or platforms (Demandbase / 6Sense), and ideally the CRM chops (Hubspot, Marketo) to cover the entire B2B marketing funnel. Responsibilities will include auditing clients' existing campaigns, strategizing new campaigns, configuring conversion tracking, conducting audience and keyword research, optimizing campaign performance, improving landing page performance, and reporting. Of course, this must all operate efficiently, within budget and be measured and evaluated according to industry best practice. SEO Expectations: We expect you to have a fundamental grasp on the current strategies to research keywords and optimize websites so that they rank for a higher volume of high-intent keywords and scale organic traffic and conversions. This will include auditing client sites (keywords, competitors, technical SEO), defining information architecture and technical requirements, conducting keyword research and insertion (SEO copywriting), optimizing site performance, improving organic search result listings, and link building. Additionally, this must all be done in an organized and measurable way to prove that our SEO strategy is scaling and helping generate revenue. Responsibilities Client management -- work directly with clients on a daily basis advising on strategy, technical implementation, status and performance of paid media and SEO campaigns Copywriting -- craft compelling copy for ads, landing pages, blogs, reports, and more, without relying on ChatGPT. Skilled wordsmithing to combine marketing messaging with SEO keywords Audits -- research client and competitor sites for performance and optimization potential as a basis for program recommendations Configuration -- set up of network ad accounts to ensure correct audience targeting, ad structure and conversion event tracking through Google Analytics (GA4), Tag Manager, Ad Networks, and into CRM systems (HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot [Salesforce]) Keyword Research -- expert skills with keyword tools for use in PPC/SEO and development of keyword distribution sheets and SEM campaign structures mapped to recommended site architecture and conversion opportunities Digital Advertising Strategy -- ability to understand technical products quickly and to strategize, develop and execute ad campaigns from ideation to iteration including account-based marketing (ABM), remarketing, and audience automation from CRM systems or prospecting tools (Leadlander, ZoomInfo) back into ad platforms SEO Strategy & Execution -- up-to-date knowledge of recent SEO best practices, and experience identifying and rolling out optimizations for B2B websites, including copywriting and tactics to prepare for the changes in organic search strategy due to generative A.I CRO -- ability to analyze landing page performance and behavior of users on website landing pages to identify areas of improvement and articulate conversion rate optimization hypothesis to clients Reporting -- reporting primarily based on custom-built dashboards to show the journey of attaining leads to after capturing them from digital marketing campaigns. This includes platform metrics (Google Ads etc.), website metrics (Google Analytics (GA4 / Crazy Egg) all the way through to CRM metrics (lead quality and ROI in HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot [Salesforce]) Requirements 4-6 years' relevant PPC (SEM) and SEO management experience (emphasis on B2B technical products / services), ideally in an agency Tech sector domain expertise, including working with startups Experience (certification preferred) setting up and managing campaigns in Google Ads (Search / Display / Video), LinkedIn Campaign Manager, X (Twitter) Ads, Meta Ads, Reddit Ads) History of rolling out search engine optimizations for sites from research to content creation and technical SEO to reporting Deep understanding of paid search, display, and paid social performance marketing metrics Strong copywriting skills, complemented by wordsmithing and editing abilities Technically savvy with MarTech systems from channel to database with ability to configure and optimize how systems connect and data flows work to be able to measure the entire journey of lead generation from click through to attribution in CRMs (HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot [Salesforce]) Reporting chops using combination of Google Analytics (GA4), Excel, SEMrush, Hubspot, Google Data Studio, Pardot (Salesforce), Marketo, Tag Manager, (roughly in this order of importance) In-depth knowledge of web content management systems (mainly Wordpress and WebFlow) Solid academic track record at least to Bachelor degree level Benefits Competitive salary 20 days' vacation (excluding public holidays) Health, dental and vision care Company 401(k) Brand new Macbook Flexible schedule Regular 'Crossfire' training days Team socials Location The agency is headquartered in San Francisco, California.
