This is a remote full-time contract position and is open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group setup Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports to the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns — optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals — within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI-based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience . Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, Gmail Basic Knowledge in or experience with: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and the ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly. Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment. TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous Contractors must provide their own industry hardware and a stable internet connection. About Alexa Translations Alexa Translations breaks language barriers by providing A.I.-powered translations for the world’s most prestigious legal, financial, and government institutions. Trained in Canadian French and hosted on Canadian servers, the Alexa Translations A.I. platform empowers translation teams and delivers complex, industry-specific results with unmatched quality and speed. And with two decades of award-winning service from our very own professional team of linguistic experts, you can trust that your business will be in good hands. Today, our small but mighty marketing team is tasked with supercharging the growth of Alexa Translations. So, if you are growth-obsessed, comfortable wearing multiple hats, and bring the pace and agility that a growing tech startup requires, then we want to hear from you! About You You are a talented content marketing leader with experience writing for the Legal, Financial, Government, and/or Technology industry. You are keenly able to translate complex concepts into compelling stories that speak to the issues that matter most to our audience and you have a track record of engaging with said audience across multiple platforms and channels, including digital, social, mobile, print, and broadcast. The role requires someone who has a fanatical attention to detail and can conduct thorough industry research, presenting creative briefs, keyword strategies, and more. So, if you can execute like a journalist, think like a product marketer and write like a storyteller, then this is the role for you! What You'll Do And How You'll Make An Impact Produce creative briefs and drive well-researched thought leadership pieces in the form of website copy, blogs, e-books, infographics, social media content, white papers, case studies and more, to attract and engage key target segments. Develop a content strategy that resonates across all stages of the customer journey, to help achieve business targets. Conduct interviews with subject matter experts to better understand the various target audiences. Review/edit the work of others to ensure content is accurate in grammar, messaging, style, and tone of voice, and optimized for search and user experience (UX). Manage all review cycles as needed. Craft product-related content by collaborating with design, product marketing, tech, and operations teams. Develop an editorial calendar and ensure deadlines and quality are always met via solid project management and personal drive for success. Use content to align with SEO tools and best practices. This includes activities such as keyword research and implementing link-building campaigns. Establish and regularly analyze key metrics to assess and report on effectiveness. Creation, execution, analysis and reporting of our social media and community engagement strategies. What You’ll Need Impeccable English and French and/or Spanish. 6+ years of content marketing experience in B2B SaaS or tech-related fields. Proven writing and communication skills showcasing that you can write on-demand with an appropriate tone. Entrepreneurial no-nonsense mindset with a passion for growth! Exceptional project management and organizational skills. A portfolio of original work that demonstrates your content marketing expertise. Ability to prioritize multiple projects and deliver under aggressive deadlines. Technical Skills CRM and Email Tools like Hubspot, MailChimp SEO/SEM Certifications (Hubspot, SEMrush, Ahrefs, MOZ, etc.) CMS platforms like Wordpress Google Workplace Suite, MS Office Suite Social Media/Channel Certifications (Linkedin, Facebook) Project Management Tools (Clickup, Asana, Trello) Analytics dashboards (Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.) Benefits and Perks Opportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience and in-house learning. Inspiring company culture and opportunity to learn from experienced entrepreneurs. Tackle unique challenges and face the unknown often, supported by an amazing team who really wants you to succeed. Ricoh in addition to being a global technology company specialized in printing equipment; Inspired by our purpose, we create solutions and technology that enable people to work more efficiently and find fulfillment through their work, unleashing their potential and creativity. With more than 80 years of experience in the ICT market. We are present in 180 countries and regions, we have established ourselves as a leader in technology services through a robust portfolio of solutions. At Ricoh, we are looking for the position of SEO and Paid ads Specialist. POSITION PROFILE We are looking for an SEO/PPC Marketing Specialist to join our company and play a key role in our growth and ongoing success by developing and executing our Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Pay-Per-Click (PPC) campaigns. The candidate should have knowledge of web development and content marketing. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE POSITION Develop and execute SEO, PPC campaigns in LATAM, inbound and outbound marketing to increase organic traffic, generate leads, and boost sales, ultimately increasing our ROI. (Ricoh Website, Video Corp, E-Commerce). Establish link-building strategies and set up conversion tracking to assess customer activity on our digital platforms and measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. Create, implement, and analyze the performance of our paid ads to maximize traffic and optimize conversion rates. Analyze the performance of SEO and PPC campaigns using performance metrics and analytical tools to suggest improvements for future campaigns. Create reports for LATAM. Collaborate with the content and marketing team, assisting them in creating engaging content based on SEO best practices. Compile and analyze data from all ongoing campaigns to prepare monthly progress reports for the Marketing Manager. Stay updated with the best practices of SEO and PPC to identify new ways of creating more efficient campaigns. Must be able to connect social media, Google Ads, Google Analytics. Website support SEO, Website, content optimization. (Ricoh Website, Videocorp, E-Commerce). Creation of reports for Website, SEO, and paid campaigns in Looker Studio. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS Degree in Marketing, Communications, or any related field. At least 4 years of experience in SEO, PPC, and social media marketing. Experience with keyword research and analysis tools, such as Ahrefs, SEMRush, Google Search Console, and Google Analytics. (Certifications) Experience in A/B and multivariable testing. Proven experience with paid advertising campaigns and promotions on social media. Experience working with SEO and Paid agencies. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to conduct thorough research on relevant keywords for the industry and target audience. Deep knowledge of best practices for on-page optimization, including creating titles, meta descriptions, headers, and alt tags. Understanding of strategies for local search optimization, including managing profiles on Google My Business. Skills to develop effective link-building strategies and establish valuable connections to enhance domain authority. Show more Show less

(Fully remote, async-first, DevOps SaaS demand generation, PLG, 32-40h/week, time zones: UTC-8 to UTC+2) Join Checkly, a Gartner Cool Vendor, as the Senior Digital Marketing Manager and be at the forefront of the Monitoring as Code (MaC) movement, recently recognized in two Gartner Hype Cycles. Our marketing team plays a critical role in scaling our reach and impact, targeting DevOps, Platform Engineering, and SRE professionals. We have thousands of users and hundreds of customers, including 1Password, Autodesk, AutoTrader, CrowdStrike, Deno, Render, Sentry, and Vercel. We're inviting a results-driven marketer who is deeply embedded in Product-Led Growth (PLG) strategies and understands the DevOps persona to work alongside a team that focuses on metrics, results, and delivering modern monitoring solutions to our users and customers. We care about building a team where people of all backgrounds are encouraged to do their best work. To achieve this we built a flexible, fully remote and async-first startup environment with inclusive benefits. Key areas of impact Data-Driven Demand Generation: Spearhead initiatives that drive qualified leads and nurture them through the sales funnel, leveraging data to continuously optimize. PLG Excellence: Implement PLG frameworks that accelerate user activation, product adoption, and customer loyalty. Cross-Channel Marketing: Your role is to be the orchestrator of all digital marketing channels— including SEO, SEM, Social Media, Display, Email, Video, Content —ensuring alignment with PLG and DevOps focus. Agency Management: Work collaboratively with external agencies and consultants to scale our marketing activities, making data-driven adjustments for maximum impact. Paid Channel Expertise: Direct and manage a broad range of paid channel strategies, encompassing paid search, paid social, and other digital advertising platforms. What You'll Do As the 4th member of the marketing team that consists of our CMO, Product Marketing Manager and Developer Relations, you will: Customize, execute, and scale digital marketing strategies that resonate specifically with DevOps audiences. Employ advanced analytics to make informed decisions, focusing on KPIs and ROI. Coordinate with product and sales teams to run PLG-aligned A/B tests and conversion experiments. Utilize a variety of MarTech solutions to automate and scale our marketing efforts, keeping an eye on performance metrics. Collaborate with external agencies to amplify PLG-aligned marketing campaigns. Lead Paid Channels: Oversee the strategy, implementation, and ongoing optimization of all paid media campaigns across various platforms. SEO Strategy and Execution: Develop and implement SEO strategies, ensuring our content ranks high in search engines and drives organic traffic. What You Should Have Proven Track Record: Demonstrable success in top-of-funnel growth and ability to scale demand generation initiatives. Affinity for Technology and PLG strategies: A balanced focus between technology-savviness and applying PLG motions effectively. DevOps Persona Expertise: A deep understanding of the DevOps landscape, its personas, and the marketing strategies that resonate with this audience. Data-Driven Decision-Making: Exceptional skills in using analytics tools like Google Analytics, SEMRush, etc., to measure impact and guide strategy. Exceptional Communication: Excellent written and spoken English for crafting persuasive and impactful marketing messages. Remote & Team Player: Ability to work autonomously and be self-motivated in a remote, async-first environment, while also contributing positively to the team dynamic. In-depth Paid Channel Experience: Robust experience in effectively managing paid search and social media campaigns, with a focus on budget allocation and ROI measurement. SEO Expertise: Proven ability in optimizing website content for search engines, conducting keyword research, and improving organic search rankings. What we offer Become part of a fast-growing, international, and remote team where you can have a real impact Fully remote, flexible work hours, async-first and transparent culture If you’re located in North America, you must be willing to work East Coast hours to have some overlap with our team in Europe. Stock options 27 days of paid vacation + your local public holidays Paid sick leave & up to 14 weeks of paid parental leave $1,000 learning & visiting budget Co-working budget or home office setup Bi-annual company retreats Employment & contractor options Find out more here. What we pay Fair, competitive, and transparent pay is very important for us. Therefore we work with a standardized salary calculator that includes several factors such as seniority level as well as location. For this role, the range is $128,570 - $142,850 for someone in US Tier 1 locations (Austin, Boston, LA, NY, SF, Seattle, Washington). $102,850 - $114,280 for someone in all other US locations. €79,200 - €88,000 for someone in a similar cost of market as UK, Germany etc. If you live in a lower cost of market location, that also moves the pay range. Apply If this sounds interesting, please apply! Studies by several different sources have shown that on average men will apply for a job if they meet 60% of the application requirements. Women/non-binary people will seek to match a much higher percentage of requirements before applying. If you're not sure you're the right fit, apply anyway and let us know what you bring to the table. We'd love to hear from you! We're all about being transparent and setting clear expectations. That's why we've put together our hiring playbook. There you'll find a sneak peek of who we are and what you can expect in our hiring process. We recently also open-sourced our employee handbook! Compensation Range: $102.9K - $142.9K Show more Show less

About Truewerk TRUEWERK, based in Denver, Colorado, is reimagining life and work in the trades by engineering the world’s most technically-advanced, high-performance workwear. Today’s trade professionals rely on workwear that keeps them safe, comfortable, and capable of working at their best. By innovating technical fabrics that provide unmatched performance in hot weather or layer together in cold and inclement weather, TRUEWERK is proud to support the men and women across the trades who build tomorrow. TRUEWERK services customers in the US and Canada on TRUEWERK.com and Amazon, and outfits businesses via its enterprise uniform program. Position Summary We’re looking for an up-and-coming Paid Marketing Manager or Associate Manager near Denver, CO to manage and optimize the Truewerk advertising channels in pursuit of effective and efficient customer engagement and conversion. This junior role involves measuring and optimizing the audiences, ad creatives and tactics across key digital and traditional channels, leveraging customer insights and ad results to improve creative performance, and exploring new channels to reach our customers. You excel in agency management with a focus on results and metrics, overseeing key digital platforms and fostering collaboration with agency partners to drive continuous improvement in our marketing programs. With a keen focus on insightful reporting and analytics, you’ll contribute to data-driven decision-making, ensuring alignment with departmental goals. Your commitment to excellence extends to meticulous budget management and contributing to overall marketing performance and business results. This role reports to the Senior Director of Performance Marketing and works closely with the eCommerce team, Marketing team, advertising agencies, and vendors of Truewerk. The position is based in Denver, CO with flexibility to work remotely based on business needs. Salary Range: $75,000 - $90,000 per year base salary What you’ll do Advertising Channel Strategy Develop creative briefs for paid advertisements, promotional collateral, and new channel assets. Explore, assess, and expand new channels, tactics, and creative methodologies to enhance the efficiency of paid channels. (Reddit, TikTok, etc.) Establish and sustain a continuous feedback loop for results, emphasizing the identification of drivers of effective ad creative to inform better creative outcomes and performance. Agency Management Take ownership of day-to-day agency and vendor management, focusing on Television, SEM, Paid Social, Affiliates and other key digital platforms. Lead ongoing optimization efforts across key advertising and marketing channels in collaboration with agency partners. Direct and guide agency partners through monthly and quarterly planning and revenue and efficiency forecasting. Facilitate the seamless exchange of ad trafficking and collateral between internal teams and agency resources. Reporting and Analytics Define, manage, and track monthly, quarterly, and annual advertising budgets. Generate insightful and actionable reports to guide agency tactics, creative insights, paid ad efficiency, and overall marketing performance. Measure and report on the efficacy of marketing campaigns, extracting insights and assessing alignment with departmental and organizational goals. Analyze customer and audience insights, devising and testing innovative targeting and creative approaches to connect with the Truewerk target customer. Project Management, Technical Integrations Collaborate on technical implementation with site operations and agencies to ensure accurate and reliable ad performance measurement. (Pixel implementation, Shopify integrations, etc.) Collaborate closely with the CRM team to seamlessly integrate and evaluate new first-party audiences and share insights on performance Partner with the site operations team to implement, maintain, and audit tracking technologies, including UTM, and ensure accuracy of on-site measurement. What you’ll bring Experience and Education 3+ years in Marketing Proven working experience in digital marketing A career encompassing goal-oriented, quantitative roles in media or marketing Experience with both ad agency and brand side for DTC ecommerce brands preferred Apparel or similar softgoods or hardgoods experience a plus ​​Prior experience with paid search preferred Experience in setting up and optimizing PPC campaigns on all major search engines Technical Skills Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools (Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, SEMRush) Demonstrable experience managing SEO/SEM, social media and/or display advertising campaigns Working knowledge of ad tracking pixels and ad measurement tools Exhibited comfort with analytics (Google sheets, Excel) Experience with Project Management tools preferred (Monday.com, Asana, Trello) Key Competencies Demonstrated ability and comfort with project management A love of reporting, analytics and KPI benchmarking Highly organized and detail oriented Goal driven, analytical Leans into deadlines and thrives in a fast-paced environment Work Location and Travel Employees in the Denver area work a hybrid schedule with some days spent in our office All team members should have interest and ability to occasionally visit customers, partners, and industry events Relocation assistance is not provided by Truewerk Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that some candidates, including women and people of color, are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Truewerk we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience or education doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. Why Truewerk 100% paid employee Health Care coverage for Colorado employees with equivalent contribution to ICHRA for employees located outside Colorado 100% paid employee Dental coverage and optional Vision coverage, nationwide Affordable coverage for dependents and domestic partners Optional Truewerk-funded HSA account Employer-paid Group Term Life and AD&D insurance Employer-paid Short-Term Disability coverage Optional Long-Term Disability Coverage Automatic monthly technology stipend Flexible Vacation Policy - and we use it! Yearly Bonus based on personal and company performance Workwear for you and discounts for friends and family Fun, casual, open-office environment Opportunities to work from home Flexible schedules; we honor what matters in your life Strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion Truewerk is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, and local laws. Applications for this role are expected to be accepted through February 29, 2024. Show more Show less

Overview Audacy has an immediate opening for a Digital Sales Specialist to support our northeast media sales teams and managers. The position is hybrid and requires availability to report to one of our NE offices for team days in person and as needed for training needs. The Digital Sales Specialist will expect to be a SME in our programs, processes and product offerings. The Digital Sales Specialist must be analytical, organized, solution minded, consultative and customer centric. Responsibilities What You'll Do: Support Media Sales Teams and Managers on target and grow prospect lists, digital research and audits, strategic plans and sales training among staff as new programs and processes are rolled out. Identify and generate digital sales opportunities to grow digital revenue while working and supporting in market DSMs as needed. Able to multi-task with a high degree of time management and organizational skills, this individual is capable of looking ahead and managing client needs with precision planning and anticipation. Recommend specific digital products to support the different areas in the “sales funnel” and fine tune proposals to present to clients. Lead digital sales trainings educating the local sales team on Audacy’s digital offerings and go-to-market strategies Qualifications Required & Preferred: 2+ years sales related experience preferred 2+ years digital marketing experience preferred College Degree preferred. Proven success in building client marketing campaigns by utilizing digital platforms(Search, Social, Display, Video) Thorough understanding of advertising and marketing A creative mind to put together unique campaigns focused on solving client needs Strong problem solving skills - you’re someone who identifies a problem as an Opportunity to improve processes Proficiency in MS Office Programs including Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Google Workspace Products Must be self-motivated, self-disciplined, have a positive attitude and be an effective Communicator A valid driver’s license, satisfactory completion of a motor vehicle record check, and, if the position requires use of applicant’s own vehicle, proof of insurance, is required Experience In The Following Programs/areas Are a Plus Advisr, WideOrbit, Meta, Google Ads, Google Sheets, Pivot Tables, SEMrush, Placer.ai, MediaRadar, Canva Pay Transparency Additional Information The anticipated starting salary range for New York-based individuals expressing interest in this position is $64,200-$73,000/yr. Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities and location of the applicant, as well as internal and external equity. About Us Audacy, Inc. is a leading multi-platform audio content and entertainment company with the country’s best collection of local music, news and sports brands, a premium podcast creator, major event producer, and digital innovator. Audacy engages 200 million consumers each month, bringing people together around content that matters to them. Learn more at www.audacyinc.com , Facebook (Audacy Corp), X (@AudacyCorp), LinkedIn (@Audacy-Inc), Instagram (@lifeataudacy) and Threads (@Audacy_Corp). job_summary: TopRank Marketing is looking for an SEO Specialist who is passionate about digital marketing and driving results for Fortune 500 clients, with the ability to plan and execute SEO strategy and tactics on behalf of a book of clients. This role is 100% remote, with little to no travel required. Essential Functions Support SEO Strategy Development Support the development of search strategies aligned with client program objectives and actionable within scope. Develop tactical plans aligned with overall program and search strategies, and executable within scope. This may include the identification of target keywords, published pages to optimize, technical actions to prioritize, or internal linking strategies. SEO Tactical Execution Conduct research to develop data-driven, informative keyword glossaries that inform content planning, optimization and development. Provide inputs to the client and content team for opportunities to optimize existing content for performance in search. Implement link building strategies Conduct technical audits and develop tactical recommendations to implement recommendations aligning with best practices. Provide inputs for the development of net new content aligning with client strategy and objectives. Develop and review results reports to document insights and account for them in your ongoing work. SEO Quality Assurance Provide inputs to and quality checking for work executed by search vendors, including keyword research, on page optimizations, technical optimizations and accurate implementation. Client Consultation Maintain a deep understanding of the client's product, personal pain points, and goals as they apply to a program or specific deliverables. Surface opportunities to improve client results as you become aware of them Present in client meetings on relevant deliverables in a way that demonstrates value and ties back to program objectives. Ensure client satisfaction by monitoring and addressing risk points, flagging needs for workflow refinement, and adhering to TopRank Marketing quality standards. Team Consultation Communicate with colleagues and clients in a professional and productive manner. Collaborate with the team on deliverables, brainstorms, and problem-solving. Active engagement in SEO and Search community; keep current on trends and best practices. Required Qualifications Fluent in the English language, exceptional grammatical understanding, and ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Able to clearly communicate both verbally and in writing regarding SEO, marketing strategies, and tactical recommendations. 2-3 years of experience working in an SEO role Familiarity working with SEO tools, such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SEMRush, Google Search Console, MajesticSEO, Screaming Frog, etc. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Marketing, Communications or Computer Science/IT (or years of experience in commensurate). Agency experience also preferred to manage the multiple priorities of a variety of clients. Show more Show less

IVX Health is a leading provider of high-quality infusion therapy for individuals with complex chronic conditions. Our company is a company rooted in core values that empower its employees. We strive daily to embody our company mantras — Be Kind , Do What’s Right , Never Settle , Make It Happen , and Enjoy the Ride . At the heart of our organization, we offer a different, better approach to the way we treat our patients and believe it is vital to take the same approach with our employees. We are looking for a student to join us for our 2023 Internship Program. This individual will support the Marketing Team in IVX Health’s headquarters in Brentwood, Tennessee. Along with the responsibilities listed below, interns will present a final project to the IVX Leadership Team; the final presentation will highlight the projects and accomplishments they worked on during their time with the company. NxtWave is one of India's fastest-growing Ed-Tech startups. NxtWave is revolutionising the 21st-century job market by transforming youth into highly skilled tech professionals irrespective of their educational background with its CCBP 4.0 programs. NxtWave is founded by Rahul Attuluri (Ex Amazon, IIIT Hyderabad), Sashank Reddy (IIT Bombay) and Anupam Pedarla (IIT Kharagpur). In February 2023, NxtWave raised 275 crore led by Greater Pacific Capital, a leading international private equity firm. The startup is also backed by Orios Ventures, Better Capital and marquee angels, including founders of some of India's unicorns. NxtWave is an official partner for NSDC, under the Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship, Govt. of India, and recognized by NASSCOM, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Govt. of India, and Startup India. The startup has received accolades as' The Greatest Brand in Education' in a research-based listing by URS Media, a leading international media house.By offering vernacular content and interactive learning, NxtWave is breaking the entry barrier for learning tech skills. Learning in their mother tongue helps learners achieve higher comprehension, deeper attention, longer retention, and greater outcomes. NxtWave now has paid subscribers from 450+ districts across India. In just 2 years, CCBP 4.0 learners have been hired by 1500+ companies including Google, Amazon, Nvidia, Goldman Sachs, Oracle, Deloitte, and more. Scale at which we operate on tech level (as on July 22) 370 Cr+ learning minutes spent 69 Cr+ Code Runs 4.2 Bn. + API Requests Handled by our servers About The Role As an SEO Analyst at Nxtwave, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our online presence through strategic search engine optimization (SEO). Your focus will be on conducting in-depth keyword research, competitor analysis, and identifying backlinking opportunities to improve our website's domain authority and search engine rankings. Key Responsibilities Conduct detailed keyword research to identify and target high-potential keywords that align with our business objectives and audience needs. Perform thorough competitor keyword and backlink analysis to understand their SEO strategies and identify areas for improvement in our own approach. Identify low-competitive yet high-potential keywords to optimize our content and increase visibility in search engine results. Discover the backlinking opportunities to enhance our website's domain authority and secure high-quality backlinks. Build organic backlinks through strategic posting in directories and other relevant platforms, in line with best SEO 1-2 years of experience in an SEO-focused role, with a strong foundation in SEO principles and practices. Proficiency in SEO tools such as Ahrefs, Google Keyword Planner, SEMrush, Moz, etc. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and trends to inform SEO strategies. job_title: Remote Paid Search Specialist (PPC) - Nationwide, US
job_summary: This is a remote position and is open to candidates anywhere in the United States. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish, and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group set up Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports into the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns - optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google: Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, gMail Basic Knowledge in or experience with similar tools such as: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu, or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous To learn more about Brafton, CHECK US OUT HERE Benefits Include: Health, Dental, Vision, Colonial Life, 401k with Match, Paid Time Off, remote work perks and more! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training. Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Brafton (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Job Details Level : Experienced Job Location : Undisclosed Position Type : Full Time Salary Range : $81,000.00 - $97,200.00 Salary Travel Percentage : Up to 10% Description Are you an experienced digital marketer with a proven record of success in generating demand for B2B solutions? Are you ready to make a difference as part of a mission-driven company? As the digital marketing manager, you'll be instrumental in driving the digital marketing strategy for E Source. This is a new role for E Source that reports to the director of demand generation and marketing operations. You'll be an instrumental member of a rapidly growing marketing team, responsible for guiding and implementing our digital marketing strategy to help drive revenue and profitability. If you're passionate about sustainability and thrive on building a data-driven digital marketing strategy, let's talk! E Source provides predictive data science, research and advisory, and solution services to help utilities make decisions that benefit their customers, their bottom line, and our planet. What You'll Do Manage paid advertising campaigns-including Google Ads, social media advertising, and display advertising-to drive targeted traffic and conversions Build and execute SEO and SEM strategies and tactics Review and analyze competitors' digital marketing activities Analyze and recommend improvements to enhance website performance and lead capture, scoring, and nurture processes Monitor and analyze social media channels to optimize our presence and reach Plan, implement, and manage digital marketing campaigns in close partnership with the solutions marketing team Create and optimize email marketing campaigns Monitor and analyze KPIs, leveraging Google Analytics to measure digital performance Manage the budget for digital campaigns Stay current with the latest digital marketing trends and strategies Work with outside vendors, agencies, and consultants as necessary What Will Make You a Good Fit Four to six years of B2B digital marketing experience Track record of increasing organic search traffic, rankings, and revenue Experience with website analytics and technical SEO tools, such as Google Analytics 4, Semrush, and Hotjar Solid experience executing successful paid search campaigns using Google Ads and paid social campaigns using LinkedIn Experience with any or all of the following: Marketo or another marketing automation system Salesforce or another CRM ABM platforms such as 6Sense or ZoomInfo Website development and analytics SEO, SEM, and PPC strategies and tactics Marketing operations strategies Creating calls to action and landing pages that drive conversion Lead nurturing and scoring Highly self-motivated; results-oriented; positive, can-do attitude; team player; detail-oriented; and organized Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with all levels of staff and management Strong computer skills, including with Microsoft Office products BS or BA in marketing, communications, or other relevant discipline A Little About E Source Utilities across the US and Canada face the same fundamental, day-to-day challenges: to ensure reliable service for every customer while maintaining and modernizing aging distribution networks and meeting regulatory requirements-all while keeping rates affordable. At the same time, climate change has created a common, universal call to action: to reduce our carbon impact, improve our environment, and ensure the prosperity of future generations. At E Source, We're Dedicated To Helping Every Utility Become a Sustainable Utility. That Means Doing The Hard Work It Takes To Achieve Goals That Often Seem At Odds With One Another Environmental responsibility: Decarbonizing operations, reducing emissions, eliminating water leaks, and finding efficiencies Reliability: Providing safe, continuous, and consistent service in the face of increasing volatility caused by climate change, including extreme weather, drought, and fire Equity: Making services and programs truly available to all, especially low- and moderate-income residential customers and small and midsize businesses who are often disproportionately impacted by societal events Financial stability: Ensuring a bottom line that affords capital and operational expenditures while enabling innovation and giving back to our communities E Source blends industry-leading research, predictive data science, and solution services to help utilities make better decisions to serve their customers, their bottom line, and our planet. With a commitment to practical innovation, we use more than three decades of utility-focused experience and our unique solution set to help our clients become a Sustainable Utility. Benefits We offer excellent insurance packages, including medical, dental, and vision plans; company-paid life insurance; company-paid long- and short-term disability insurance; and medical and dependent-care flexible spending plans. We provide a flexible time off (FTO) program; E Source employees can take as many paid days off per year as they need, with manager approval, while fulfilling their work obligations and ensuring proper coverage of their responsibilities. We offer flexible schedules, flexible work locations, and a paid parental leave benefit. We provide a 401(k)/RRSP plan with a 3% employer match. The budgeted salary for this position is $81,000 to $97,200 USD (includes base + annual bonus) . Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience. This person can work remote, a hybrid schedule, or from one of our physical locations. Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US. We're unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas at this time. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We contact applicants directly via email using only our designated company email addresses with the domain of @esource.com. Please do not provide personal information to anyone over email and be wary of other accounts impersonating businesses. Qualifications PDN-9b1441ff-9af1-4b07-a7d2-ecfab2469195 Show more Show less

Job Title and Description: Search Engine Optimization Strategist About The Job Are you a dynamic and results-driven SEO professional with a passion for maximizing online visibility and revenue? We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated SEO Strategist to join our team. As a key player, you will be responsible for driving organic traffic, enhancing search engine rankings, and optimizing our client's business to achieve unparalleled success. What We Offer Basic Salary ranges from $71K to $100K (negotiable based on experience). Bonus: Earn up to $2,500 per quarter. Benefits: 401(k) with matching Dental Insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Vision insurance Qualifications Required 3+ years of experience in digital marketing with an emphasis on SEO Minimum of 1 year SEO experience with on-site optimization and copywriting A clear understanding of how SEO fits into a larger online marketing strategy and interacts with other marketing tactics Experience managing 4+ client relationships simultaneously Stellar written and verbal communication skills shown in navigating emotionally charged conversations, creating clarity in emails, creating meaningful dialogue during presentations, etc. Preferred Relevant Certifications: Google Analytics Prior experience with Lead Generation and E-Commerce businesses Responsibilities Keyword Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive keyword research to identify high-value and relevant keywords for product pages. Analyze competitor keywords and industry trends to stay ahead of the curve. On-Page Optimization: Optimize product pages for search engines, strategically placing content, meta tags, and headers to be keyword-rich. Implement schema markup and other on-page SEO techniques to enhance search engine visibility. Technical SEO: Collaborate with the development team to ensure the website's technical infrastructure is SEO-friendly. Monitor website performance, address crawl issues, and improve site speed. Skills: HTML/CSS, Basic Javascript, WordPress, common Ecommerce CMS (Shopify, BigCommerce, Magento etc.), Google Analytics (Goals, Attribution, Funnels), Google Tag Manager, Office Suites (Slides/PowerPoint, Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel), SEMrush, BrightLocal, Ahrefs, etc. Content Strategy: Develop and execute a content strategy aligned with SEO goals, covering product descriptions, blog posts, and other relevant content. Optimize content for search engines and user experience. Link Building: Execute effective link-building strategies to increase the authority and credibility of the online store. Identify and pursue relevant opportunities for backlink acquisition. SEO Data Analysis and Reporting: Use analytics tools to track and analyze key performance indicators, providing regular reports on SEO performance. Identify areas for improvement and adjust strategies accordingly. Stay Informed on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of industry changes, search engine algorithms, and emerging SEO trends. Apply new knowledge to continually improve the client’s business site's SEO performance. Sales/Product Reporting & Analysis: Ensure data accuracy, organization, and timely reporting. Generate daily reports on sales, profit margins, and product performance. Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis. The Strategist’s main KPI is Managed Revenue, defined as the revenue paid to Rocket Clicks by clients for Organic Search services, shared among the participating team members. Each Strategist is expected to manage $30,000 in revenue. The exact Managed Revenue expectations will fluctuate due to company conditions and will be visible and communicated regularly to the Strategist. The ideal candidate is not only a passionate, independent, and confident digital marketing expert with an emphasis in SEO but also has excellent people skills and can effectively discuss digital strategies from the perspective of a growth-minded business owner. If you are ready to make a significant impact in the world of Search Engine Optimization and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we invite you to apply. Join us and be a crucial part of a team dedicated to achieving unparalleled success online. About Rocket Clicks Who We Are Founded in 2008, our Milwaukee-area Paid and SEO agency has worked with some of the brightest, most agile minds in digital marketing - team members and partners, alike! Each of us brings unique skills and experiences to the table, and we have seen time and time again how the diverse experiences of our team members - both personal and professional - propel us forward and allow us to provide continuously groundbreaking insights. Rocket Clicks is a team in the truest sense of the word. We share knowledge freely and have no hidden agendas. Within our walls you'll hear the word "friend" used more often than "coworker," and we understand that collaboration is at the core of our success. Our Values In Action It's one thing for us to say who we are and what we do. It's another thing to carry through on these promises. Our team is always staying on top of the latest developments in search engine marketing. It’s how we stay sharp. But we don't just horde this information - you can check out our analysis of the most important industry news and deliver informed insights on our blog. We also curate the most important industry news as it happens on our Twitter feed. We talk a lot about our awesome culture, passion for giving back to our community, and celebration of team achievements. We always love to get feedback on what we've been up to, your opinions on the news of the day, and your questions for our staff about what's going on in the rapidly refreshing world of Internet marketing. Why We Work We love to help businesses thrive online via smart, ethical search marketing. We strive to enrich the lives and livelihoods of our partners and our staff, and we deliver real, quantifiable results. We employ leaders at all levels of our company. No university teaches what we know. Raw talent needs training, and in our subtle yet complex industry, training has to be well-informed and unending. Curiosity and reaching are core values. Every time innovation shuffles the deck, we know it is an opportunity to distance our partners from the competition. We stand shoulder to shoulder with partners who are leaders and winners within their industries. Show more Show less

Overview: At Saje Natural Wellness, our mission is to connect people with the healing power of plants so that everyone can live their life to the fullest, naturally. Since 1992, we’ve been committed to creating 100% natural products that are rooted in function and designed to help people tune into their personal wellness. And just like nature, we’re continually growing! We’re on the lookout for top talent to join our team, in our stores, offices and distribution centres. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, flexibility in working styles and a commitment to professional growth and personal wellness supported by a generous Team Member discount on our products. The impact you'll make: As the Senior SEO Specialist, you will play a crucial role in driving organic traffic to our websites, increasing brand visibility, and improving our search engine rankings. You will be responsible for developing and implementing effective SEO strategies, both technical as well as content driven to improve overall website ranking and KPI’s. Reporting into the Sr. Digital Merchandising Manager, this role combines both strategic thinking and day-to-day tactics. What you'll do: Keyword Strategy Development and Execution: Undertake comprehensive keyword research to identify high-impact keywords aligned with business objectives and key categories. Formulate and execute a strategic keyword strategy to enhance organic search rankings and visibility. Continuously refine and optimize keyword strategies based on performance metrics and market trends. On-Page Optimizations (OPO): Audit existing as well as write compelling and high-quality website content, including product detail pages and product landing pages Collaborate with content creators and developers to prioritize and implement on-page optimizations. Conduct regular audits of existing content and meta fields, identifying areas for improvement. Implement SEO best practices to enhance user experience and search engine visibility. SEO-Driven Content: Conduct content audits to assess the effectiveness and relevance of existing content Write and collaborate with content teams to create compelling blog content aligned with key campaign moments and targeted keywords. Oversee the blog strategy and management, ensuring alignment with SEO goals and brand key words Ensure content is optimized for user intent, readability, and search engine algorithms. Develop and implement strategies for Local SEO to enhance visibility in specific geographic locations. Optimize Google My Business profiles and local citations for all relevant business locations. Technical Enhancements: Address technical SEO issues, including backlinks, missing/duplicate meta descriptions, broken links, and HREFLANG values Collaborate with the technical team to implement improvements in site structure and URL optimization, ensuring it is prioritized within sprint releases Stay informed about technical SEO advancements and proactively implement updates Keyword Search Optimization: Conduct in-depth analysis of Product Detail Pages (PDPs) to optimize on-page content for targeted keywords Collaborate with product teams to ensure accurate and compelling product descriptions that align with SEO goals and keyword search strategy Implement strategies to enhance the visibility and relevance of product-related keywords Influence and collaborate with digital marketing team to identify keyword strategy to impact ROAS Reporting and Communication: Oversee SEO GANTT execution, developing and maintaining regular, transparent reports on key performance indicators Oversee the SEO roadmap, outlining key initiatives and timelines for implementation, helping prioritizing key initiatives that will drive results Communicate insights, trends, and recommendations to cross-functional teams Working along side our SEO agency to provide actionable recommendations for continuous improvement based on data-driven analysis and industry best practices Your Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree or diploma in eCommerce/Marketing or related field; or equivalent years of combined education & experience Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or in a similar role, preferably within the e-commerce D2C brand minimum 3 years. In-depth knowledge of SEO best practices, search engine algorithms, and ranking factors. Proficiency in SEO tools, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google My Business, SEMrush, or Moz. Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to drive actionable insights, with an excellent understanding of keyword research and content optimization techniques. SEO content writing experience Technical SEO knowledge, including website audits, crawl analysis, and optimization for mobile and site speed. Shopify Experience preferred Experience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress) and basic HTML/CSS skills. Ability to problem solve and seek out solutions Flexible team player who thrives in environments requiring ability to effectively prioritize and juggle multiple concurrent projects Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams. What's in it for you? Here at Saje, we understand that joining a team is an important decision to make, so we want to tell you a bit more about the Opportunity. Base pay is dependent on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. Aspirational Workspaces - every detail is considered to connect you to our culture. Wellness days to ensure you're taking care of you mental and physical health. MISSION Missions are accomplished with people, driving towards a greater purpose. Foley has been a trusted partner to motor carriers of all sizes. Our technologically advanced approach to DOT compliance automates many of the background screening and compliance requirements motor carriers must comply with- making it easier for them to onboard and retain the right driver for their business. At Foley we just don’t help our customers stay compliant – we help them thrive. A positive attitude is everything. At Foley, we’ve created a culture that rewards kindness, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude. Whether we’re working together internally or helping a customer solve a problem, we approach every challenge with a sense of humor, optimism, and the determination to succeed. SEO & PPC Manager Are you a highly motivated and results-driven digital marketer ready to take our online presence to new heights? Foley Services is seeking a dedicated SEO & PPC Manager to join our team and lead our digital marketing efforts. If you have a passion for driving traffic, boosting conversions, and staying ahead of industry trends, we want to hear from you. This is a REMOTE option - Those residing in CT, NC, MA, NH, NE, SC, GA, FL, TX, TN, NJ, IN, PA are welcome to apply! This position offers a starting salary range of $70-$80k. As the SEO & PPC Manager at Foley Services, you will be at the forefront of optimizing our online presence. Your role will be pivotal in driving traffic and conversions through various channels. You'll take charge of managing paid advertising campaigns on platforms like Google, Bing, LinkedIn, and others. Additionally, you'll provide valuable insights and track our organic search traffic. This hands-on role requires a deep understanding of SEO and PPC strategies, data analysis skills, and a relentless commitment to staying updated on industry trends. What Will You Do Develop and execute highly effective SEO and PPC strategies to increase website traffic, enhance user engagement, and boost conversions. Daily management and optimization of paid advertising campaigns on Google, Bing, LinkedIn, and other relevant platforms. Create compelling ad copy and visually engaging ad templates for paid search assets. Conduct in-depth keyword research and analysis to identify opportunities for improving search engine rankings and enhancing paid ad performance. Utilize analytics tools to closely monitor, analyze, and report on website traffic, conversions, and campaign performance. Collaborate closely with content and web development teams to ensure SEO best practices are consistently implemented. Stay current with industry trends and algorithm changes to keep our digital marketing efforts competitive. Provide regular reports and insights to the Growth Team to track progress and recommend improvements. What We Would Like You To Have Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, or a related field. Proven track record in SEO and PPC management, backed by a robust portfolio of successful campaigns. Proficiency in SEO tools such as Moz, SEMrush, or similar platforms. Hands-on experience with Google Ads, Bing Ads, Meta, and LinkedIn Advertising. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. If you're ready to take your career in digital marketing to the next level and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to success, we encourage you to apply for the SEO & PPC Manager position at Foley Services. Join us in driving our online presence to new heights and making a significant impact on our digital marketing efforts. What You’ll Love About Foley The people! Our employees and customers consistently express the best thing about Foley is our close-knit, exceptionally talented teams. Check out our customers feedback – on Trustpilot Outstanding benefits. 3 medical plans to choose from, 2 level dental, and 2 level vision plans. Generous vacation, sick, and personal time off. 401K plan with a match. We’ve got your back so you can live your best life. It’s about ideas over egos. You will have the freedom to explore new ideas and approaches in an entrepreneurial environment, supported by a collaborative team. Professional growth. We open our roles to our employees first and encourage them to apply for growth opportunities. Our People Operations team is available to discuss career growth and help put a plan in place, helping employees achieve the growth they crave. Our environment! We celebrate success and believe in transparency and teamwork to get us there. We invest in collaboration tools so you can meet with your team face to face. Many of our roles are remote and we want to ensure our employees are engaged and can interact with their peers in a virtual space. What We Do, How We Do It Too often, companies use a piecemeal approach when it comes to screening drivers. They might use one vendor to help recruit. Another to screen. And still, another to address the complex world that is compliance. This approach is inefficient, expensive, and redundant. Not to mention, it makes it too easy for things to fall through the cracks. At Foley, we've built a company that effortlessly manages these three areas under one roof: recruit, screen, comply. Thanks to powerful technology combined with our compliance expertise, we're able to deliver a comprehensive solution to our customers and, as a result, a better overall customer experience. Where We're Headed We're always developing new solutions to slay tomorrow's recruitment, screening, and compliance monsters. At the core of these solutions is our vast collection of data—and the many ways to leverage it, whether that's developing software to calculate a company's compliance risk or implementing predictive analytics to identify the best drivers. What It's Like To Work With Us Diving deep into a niche industry and becoming an expert . . . Continually growing and advancing . . . Making lifelong friends during the process . . . That Sums Up What It's Like To Work For Us. We're a 250+ Person Company On The Verge Of Explosive Growth Thanks To Our AI-powered Technology—and Where It's Headed With Predictive Analytics. Five Jars is looking for an experienced and results-driven Digital Marketing Manager to implement the company’s strategy and actively participate in business development via marketing activities. You are the right person for this position if you are ready to take on a new challenge, contribute to the growth of a US-based digital agency, and help us tell about our services to inspiring organizations. Who are we Five Jars is a Full-service Design, Strategy, and Web Development digital agency that creates intuitive, data-driven web experiences. job_summary: Are you passionate about SEO? Do you strive to be the best at what you do? About 180 Marketing 180 Marketing is one of the leading eCommerce SEO companies in the world. About Truewerk TRUEWERK, based in Denver, Colorado, is reimagining life and work in the trades by engineering the world’s most technically-advanced, high-performance workwear. Today’s trade professionals rely on workwear that keeps them safe, comfortable, and capable of working at their best. By innovating technical fabrics that provide unmatched performance in hot weather or layer together in cold and inclement weather, TRUEWERK is proud to support the men and women across the trades who build tomorrow. TRUEWERK services customers in the US and Canada on TRUEWERK.com and Amazon, and outfits businesses via its enterprise uniform program. Position Summary We’re looking for an up-and-coming Paid Marketing Manager or Associate Manager near Denver, CO to manage and optimize the Truewerk advertising channels in pursuit of effective and efficient customer engagement and conversion. This junior role involves measuring and optimizing the audiences, ad creatives and tactics across key digital and traditional channels, leveraging customer insights and ad results to improve creative performance, and exploring new channels to reach our customers. You excel in agency management with a focus on results and metrics, overseeing key digital platforms and fostering collaboration with agency partners to drive continuous improvement in our marketing programs. With a keen focus on insightful reporting and analytics, you’ll contribute to data-driven decision-making, ensuring alignment with departmental goals. Your commitment to excellence extends to meticulous budget management and contributing to overall marketing performance and business results. This role reports to the Senior Director of Performance Marketing and works closely with the eCommerce team, Marketing team, advertising agencies, and vendors of Truewerk. The position is based in Denver, CO with flexibility to work remotely based on business needs. Salary Range: $75,000 - $90,000 per year base salary What you’ll do Advertising Channel Strategy Develop creative briefs for paid advertisements, promotional collateral, and new channel assets. Explore, assess, and expand new channels, tactics, and creative methodologies to enhance the efficiency of paid channels. (Reddit, TikTok, etc.) Establish and sustain a continuous feedback loop for results, emphasizing the identification of drivers of effective ad creative to inform better creative outcomes and performance. Agency Management Take ownership of day-to-day agency and vendor management, focusing on Television, SEM, Paid Social, Affiliates and other key digital platforms. Lead ongoing optimization efforts across key advertising and marketing channels in collaboration with agency partners. Direct and guide agency partners through monthly and quarterly planning and revenue and efficiency forecasting. Facilitate the seamless exchange of ad trafficking and collateral between internal teams and agency resources. Reporting and Analytics Define, manage, and track monthly, quarterly, and annual advertising budgets. Generate insightful and actionable reports to guide agency tactics, creative insights, paid ad efficiency, and overall marketing performance. Measure and report on the efficacy of marketing campaigns, extracting insights and assessing alignment with departmental and organizational goals. Analyze customer and audience insights, devising and testing innovative targeting and creative approaches to connect with the Truewerk target customer. Project Management, Technical Integrations Collaborate on technical implementation with site operations and agencies to ensure accurate and reliable ad performance measurement. (Pixel implementation, Shopify integrations, etc.) Collaborate closely with the CRM team to seamlessly integrate and evaluate new first-party audiences and share insights on performance Partner with the site operations team to implement, maintain, and audit tracking technologies, including UTM, and ensure accuracy of on-site measurement. What you’ll bring Experience and Education 3+ years in Marketing Proven working experience in digital marketing A career encompassing goal-oriented, quantitative roles in media or marketing Experience with both ad agency and brand side for DTC ecommerce brands preferred Apparel or similar softgoods or hardgoods experience a plus ​​Prior experience with paid search preferred Experience in setting up and optimizing PPC campaigns on all major search engines Technical Skills Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools (Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, SEMRush) Demonstrable experience managing SEO/SEM, social media and/or display advertising campaigns Working knowledge of ad tracking pixels and ad measurement tools Exhibited comfort with analytics (Google sheets, Excel) Experience with Project Management tools preferred (Monday.com, Asana, Trello) Key Competencies Demonstrated ability and comfort with project management A love of reporting, analytics and KPI benchmarking Highly organized and detail oriented Goal driven, analytical Leans into deadlines and thrives in a fast-paced environment Work Location and Travel Employees in the Denver area work a hybrid schedule with some days spent in our office All team members should have interest and ability to occasionally visit customers, partners, and industry events Relocation assistance is not provided by Truewerk Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that some candidates, including women and people of color, are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Truewerk we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience or education doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. Why Truewerk 100% paid employee Health Care coverage for Colorado employees with equivalent contribution to ICHRA for employees located outside Colorado 100% paid employee Dental coverage and optional Vision coverage, nationwide Affordable coverage for dependents and domestic partners Optional Truewerk-funded HSA account Employer-paid Group Term Life and AD&D insurance Employer-paid Short-Term Disability coverage Optional Long-Term Disability Coverage Automatic monthly technology stipend Flexible Vacation Policy - and we use it! Yearly Bonus based on personal and company performance Workwear for you and discounts for friends and family Fun, casual, open-office environment Opportunities to work from home Flexible schedules; we honor what matters in your life Strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion Truewerk is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Graf-Martin has proven to be a trusted brand, marketing, publicity and communications partner for organizations championing hope, justice and generosity both in their community and worldwide. We are mission-driven and focused because we care deeply about what we do. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Digital Marketing Lead is responsible for strategy, implementation, tracking, and reporting on the company's digital marketing projects for clients, specific projects or tasks including digital marketing strategy and support, social media strategy and marketing (Facebook, Instagram, Google Ads), blogs, content strategy, Google Analytics, social metrics, and SEO/SEM. The position also provides regular support to email marketing, back-end technical for WordPress/Squarespace/Google Forms, and database analysis. In addition to client-facing projects, this position supports the operation of the Agency by finding technical solutions and advising on the appropriate tools to support agency activities. If you are looking for a role where you can apply your strengths in communications and organization while making a difference in supporting world-changing clients, we would love to meet you. We are open to accommodating the right candidate in either a full-time or part-time capacity, with a preference for individuals who can work onsite. Priority will be given to applicants able to commit to onsite collaboration, reflecting our belief in the value of direct engagement and teamwork within our company culture. Responsibilities Develops digital marketing strategy by studying economic indicators, tracking changes in supply and demand, identifying customers and their current and future needs, and monitoring the competition. Plans and executes all web, SEO/SEM, database marketing, email, social media, and display advertising campaigns. Designs, builds, and maintains the Agency’s social media presence. Coordinates with Marketing, Brand and Public Relations leads to support the creation and plan content for both client and Agency digital engagement. Measures and reports the performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assesses against goals (ROI and KPIs). Brainstorms new and creative growth strategies through digital marketing. Plans, executes, and measures experiments and conversion tests. Optimizes budget allocation and digital spend for clients to maximize campaign results. Identifies critical conversion points and drop-off points and optimizes user funnels. Supports the PR team by optimizing all content through SEO. Supports brand awareness generation for all clients and the Agency. Acts as a key contributor to all project management activities, establishing task timelines, milestones, and workback plans, and tracking effectively in project management tools. Qualifications And Skillset Demonstrated competency and experience with social media marketing; certification with Facebook Blueprint or Google Career Certificate an asset. Demonstrated competency and experience with social ad development and management; Google Grant acquisition and Google ad management required. Demonstrated experience with digital marketing tools such as HotJar, SEMrush, Ahrefs; and a familiarity with new and emerging tools. Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends, SEMRush, etc.) Working knowledge of ad serving tools Experience with WordPress, Squarespace, or other website development platforms and tools. Required Education & Experience Bachelor’s or master’s degree in marketing or a related field 3-5 years of work experience in digital marketing (non-profit experience is an asset) Experience in setting up and optimizing PPC campaigns on all major search engines Your application should include your cover letter, resume and portfolio (including any marketing, communications or social media initiatives you’ve worked on). job_summary: This is a remote position and is open to candidates anywhere in the United States. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish, and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group set up Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports into the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns - optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google: Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, gMail Basic Knowledge in or experience with similar tools such as: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu, or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous To learn more about Brafton, CHECK US OUT HERE Benefits Include: Health, Dental, Vision, Colonial Life, 401k with Match, Paid Time Off, remote work perks and more! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training. Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Brafton (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).
