About Alexa Translations Alexa Translations breaks language barriers by providing A.I.-powered translations for the world’s most prestigious legal, financial, and government institutions. Trained in Canadian French and hosted on Canadian servers, the Alexa Translations A.I. platform empowers translation teams and delivers complex, industry-specific results with unmatched quality and speed. And with two decades of award-winning service from our very own professional team of linguistic experts, you can trust that your business will be in good hands. Today, our small but mighty marketing team is tasked with supercharging the growth of Alexa Translations. So, if you are growth-obsessed, comfortable wearing multiple hats, and bring the pace and agility that a growing tech startup requires, then we want to hear from you! About You You are a talented content marketing leader with experience writing for the Legal, Financial, Government, and/or Technology industry. You are keenly able to translate complex concepts into compelling stories that speak to the issues that matter most to our audience and you have a track record of engaging with said audience across multiple platforms and channels, including digital, social, mobile, print, and broadcast. The role requires someone who has a fanatical attention to detail and can conduct thorough industry research, presenting creative briefs, keyword strategies, and more. So, if you can execute like a journalist, think like a product marketer and write like a storyteller, then this is the role for you! What You'll Do And How You'll Make An Impact Produce creative briefs and drive well-researched thought leadership pieces in the form of website copy, blogs, e-books, infographics, social media content, white papers, case studies and more, to attract and engage key target segments. Develop a content strategy that resonates across all stages of the customer journey, to help achieve business targets. Conduct interviews with subject matter experts to better understand the various target audiences. Review/edit the work of others to ensure content is accurate in grammar, messaging, style, and tone of voice, and optimized for search and user experience (UX). Manage all review cycles as needed. Craft product-related content by collaborating with design, product marketing, tech, and operations teams. Develop an editorial calendar and ensure deadlines and quality are always met via solid project management and personal drive for success. Use content to align with SEO tools and best practices. This includes activities such as keyword research and implementing link-building campaigns. Establish and regularly analyze key metrics to assess and report on effectiveness. Creation, execution, analysis and reporting of our social media and community engagement strategies. What You’ll Need Impeccable English and French and/or Spanish. 6+ years of content marketing experience in B2B SaaS or tech-related fields. Proven writing and communication skills showcasing that you can write on-demand with an appropriate tone. Entrepreneurial no-nonsense mindset with a passion for growth! Exceptional project management and organizational skills. A portfolio of original work that demonstrates your content marketing expertise. Ability to prioritize multiple projects and deliver under aggressive deadlines. Technical Skills CRM and Email Tools like Hubspot, MailChimp SEO/SEM Certifications (Hubspot, SEMrush, Ahrefs, MOZ, etc.) CMS platforms like Wordpress Google Workplace Suite, MS Office Suite Social Media/Channel Certifications (Linkedin, Facebook) Project Management Tools (Clickup, Asana, Trello) Analytics dashboards (Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.) Benefits and Perks Opportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience and in-house learning. An award-winning digital marketing agency has an immediate opening for an SEO Manager. As SEO Manager, you would be responsible for the service and management of a diverse portfolio of organic marketing programs for multiple high-profile accounts. As an agency, Gen3 Marketing provides clients with “white hat” SEO solutions that keep their website(s) in alignment with Google’s best practices for online content. Our recommendations often improve both user and search engine crawler experience, which in turn benefit our clients’ website performance. Our mission is to identify opportunities and apply optimizations that users and search engines prefer, enabling our clients to grow their online business and make the most of web traffic from all channels. Requirements & Responsibilities: Supporting strategy, planning, and analysis for client on-site and off-site SEO campaigns. Proficiently managing time and prioritizing tasks to meet monthly service allocations, demonstrating flexibility within set timelines while collaborating effectively within a team-oriented environment. Adaptively understanding client needs, crafting bespoke solutions that align with their objectives. This involves attentive listening, anticipating perspectives, and delivering targeted strategies. Conducting keyword and competitor research to support actionable recommendations. Reviewing opportunities for improving client websites from a technical perspective, including the resolution of errors and optimization of page speed performance. Manually reviewing crawl data to identify and prioritize solutions that will improve the quality and user experience on client websites. Monitoring and reporting on client website performance, including wins and opportunities. Implementing approved SEO recommendations on the behalf of clients. Drafting high-quality, original, well-researched written copy for client marketing campaigns. Editing both internally written and client-provided copy. Vetting potential link partners, drafting scripts, and conducting outreach campaigns to secure paid and organic placements on third-party websites. Publishing approved content and optimizations on the behalf of clients. Formalizing and presenting recommendations to clients for approval. Leveraging third-party tools, such as SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Moz, and Majestic to identify technical, content, and outreach opportunities. Communicating findings and recommendations to clients over the phone, email, and teleconference. Optimizing on-site content, including titles, meta descriptions, internal links, and more. Preferred Experience & Skills: Applicants with intermediate to advanced SEO experience are highly preferred. job_title: OneIMS - Digital Marketing Account Manager (SEO, PPC, & Hubspot)
job_summary: Description Are you an experienced online marketer? Do you have agency-side experience working with clients' online marketing campaigns? Are you looking for an exciting new opportunity with a growing digital marketing agency? Are you a dynamic and creative online marketing expert? If so, we could make excellent use of your talents! We are seeking a passionate, creative Account Manager to join our team. This team member is responsible for overseeing the online marketing campaigns related to SEO, PPC and comprehensive inbound marketing campaigns (Hubspot Marketing Hub) for clients in a wide variety of industries. This is an exciting hands-on role where you will work side-by-side with experienced senior online marketing specialists to successfully execute online marketing campaigns for both local and national clients. At OneIMS, we know superstar employees drive our core values of people, passion, and performance. We offer a competitive compensation plan and complete benefits package including medical/dental insurance, 401(k) with company match and more. Come join our team and work in a fun, relaxed work environment with strong growth potential! Requirements In-depth about SEO and PPC best practices Knowledgeable about search, social and content marketing disciplines Experience planning and executing SEO, social media, content and local search marketing campaigns Experience with Google Analytics, AdWords, HubSpot, Ahrefs, SEMRush and other online analytical tools Self-motivated and organized Contagious enthusiasm for the web industry and technologies Must have client-facing experience Displays critical thinking and problem-solving skills Extremely goal-oriented with a positive attitude and high energy Ability to perform well with or without detailed directions Deliver high-quality work with attention to detail Exudes confidence and leadership skills Preferred Qualifications 2+ years of experience in SEO and PPC Hubspot software Certification a plus. Marketing Agency Expereince a plus Benefits Health Insurance: Medical, Dental & Vision 401(k) Paid Time Off About The Company OneIMS is a global inbound digital marketing agency with offices in downtown Chicago, and sunny Southwest Florida and regional offices throughout the world. Our team is dedicated to helping our clients achieve their sales and marketing goals using the most up-to-date and innovative strategies and technologies available. We believe we are one of the best in the industry and are looking for candidates who are just as passionate about marketing as we are. At OneIMS you will enjoy a great working environment, plenty of perks, nurturing leadership team and caring co-workers. Come work with us if you want to make our team even better! Red Ventures is seeking an experienced SEO Associate to support one of our owned and operated brands, Energy, Bankrate, or CNET. As an SEO Associate, you will support the development and implementation of our SEO strategy, including content marketing and technical SEO responsibilities. As an SEO Associate, you will work alongside an expert Editorial team, advanced Engineers, and a world-class Design team to create a robust SEO strategy to drive brand visibility for a diverse set of websites. SEO strategy at Red Ventures moves fast, so you will have a data science and analytics team fully dedicated to creating SEO products and tools that give you access to more data and better insights, meaning you spend less time on SEMrush and more time making decisions that impact the business. An SEO Associate is an integral part of a successful marketing strategy. What You'll Do Analyze and Report Analyze organic search landscapes to find opportunities that drive valuable traffic and bottom-line value for the business in collaboration with our experience and business teams Focus on improving brand visibility through organic rankings to drive full funnel visibility via traffic volume, as well as conversions that impact the bottom-line P&L. Keep our sites and pages technically optimized for mobile users and search performance - including information architecture, schema management, semantic HTML, page speed, and other components of crawling and indexing performance. Leverage proprietary in-house marketing tools to inform strategic decisions with data. Own financial performance report and presentations with senior leadership Ideate Test, innovate, and build custom solutions with our world-class digital marketing, data science, and big data talent. Innovate with Senior SEOs and other team members as we look to build our EEAT strategy to evolve our brand and connect with our users in ways we have never done before Launch new experiences to meet and fulfill the users needs at all points in their journey Collaborate Implement Content/On-Page SEO, Technical SEO, and Off-Page SEO strategy, collaborating with world-class Editorial, UX, and creative teams. Drive an innovative content strategy working to diversify our content offering to build authority and help users at all stages of their financial life cycle What We're Looking For Passionate about innovating in organic search, don’t accept theories at face value, and enjoy testing to prove effectiveness of tactics. A self-starting, curious, proven performer with 1+ year of experience in SEO. Innovative, on-the-spot, creative problem solver who demonstrates both technical and analytical skills The ideal candidate will have strong data analytics skills; able to pull & manipulate multiple datasets to inform strategy with data. Candidates must be comfortable measuring, interpreting, and making fast-paced decisions based on large volumes of marketing performance data. Familiar with a number of SEO suites and tools including: STAT, Moz, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Majestic, Botify, and Screaming Frog. Experience working in the weeds with data using tools such as Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau, Google Cloud Projects/Big Query, Google Search Console, SQL, and other common reporting platforms. Comfortable with basic HTML for on-page SEO tactics. Able to communicate with Engineering teams for Technical SEO fixes. Comfortable working with business leaders in forecasting, competitive analysis, and business modeling. Who We Are Over the last twenty years, Red Ventures has built a portfolio of influential brands, digital platforms, and strategic partnerships that work together to connect millions of people with expert advice. Through premium content and personalized digital experiences, Red Ventures builds online journeys that make it easier for people to make important decisions about their homes, health, travel, finances, education and entertainment. Founded in 2000, Red Ventures has 3,000 employees in 10 cities across the US, as well as in the UK and Brazil. Red Ventures owns and operates several large digital brands including Healthline, The Points Guy, Bankrate, MYMOVE, and Allconnect.com. For more information, visit https://redventures.com and follow @RedVentures on social platforms. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program. Red Ventures is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at Red Ventures is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with disabilities. This includes providing reasonable accommodation where appropriate. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to apply or participate in the job application or interview process, please contact accommodation@redventures.com. If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents linked here. Compensation Cash Compensation Range: $65,000 - $106,250* Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications, and experience. Job Description As a Content Writer for Click Here Digital, you’ll write the content our clients need to succeed on the ever-shifting sands of the digital marketing landscape. You’ll work closely with the rest of the SEO department to design and implement engaging copy for our clients’ websites, business profiles on platforms like Google Business Profile, and more. You’ll also use your expertise in written English to proofread and copy-edit your own writing and others’. A Content Writer will Write 2,000+ words per day on content in a variety of formats and styles, including blog posts, landing pages, search result copy, press releases, and others Employ deep knowledge of written English to write clear, engaging content to meet clients’ marketing goals Create compelling headlines and body copy that captures the attention of the target audience Edit and proofread existing content to ensure readability and fix errors and inconsistencies Incorporate SEO best practices into content creation Work closely with other members of the SEO department, including Analysts, Associates, and Interns to deliver high-quality content on a deadline A Day in the Life: Receive a content request from an SEO Analyst and draft content to the given specifications Research important topics to write about within a given client’s field Proofread content written by other members of the SEO team Attend occasional meetings and trainings to improve job-related skills Required Qualifications: Bachelors Degree or equivalent in English, Communications, Journalism, and Creative Writing 1-2 years experience writing content 2+ years experience in a professional, detail-oriented environment Strong writing skills and abilities Proficiency in computer and internet skills Proficiency in Google or other office suites Preferred Qualifications: Experience working in an agency setting Experience with Google Search Console, Google Analytics, SEMRush or equivalent tool, Google Tag Manager, and other SEO-analytical technologies Experience in writing for automotive, legal, or ecommerce marketing Show more Show less

Who We Are If you ask us, we’re the perfect mix of athletes, entrepreneurs, engineers, and creatives. Our diverse backgrounds and shared values are what help make Hydrow great. Our mission is not just to create an amazing fitness experience, but a beautiful human experience - one that’s honest, inclusive, and positive.. Hydrow is the Live Outdoor Reality (LOR)™ rowing machine that delivers on-water experiences at home with workouts led by world-class athletes. At Hydrow, you’ll have the chance to shape a company that is disrupting the fitness industry while creating engaging content unmatched in the marketplace today. Sound exciting? That’s because it is! WHY WE NEED YOU Hydrow’s data team is seeking a Data Analyst to specialize in Marketing analytics. This role is critical to helping Marketing stakeholders understand their channels’ performance on a day-to-day basis as well as comparative channel performance via attribution modeling and cohort analyses. This Marketing analyst will help round out our data and analytics function by leveraging a number of data sources and multiple data practices from modeling to dashboarding to ensure data clarity, consistent tracking, and actionable insights are found. A successful candidate is one that can clearly understand business goals, shows resilience to data problems in a fast-paced environment, and can synthesize analyses into compelling narratives that drive decisions. This role will report to the head of Analytics and join a data team of 2 others; each also wears several different organizational hats. What You’ll Accomplish Support data roadmap goals by executing the creation of an attribution framework for our marketing channels. This includes a proposal for storing channel level data, a model framework for attribution, and devising a dashboard to showcase and integrate results with key marketing data including spend and sales. Partner with broader marketing team, including Direct Marketing, Ecommerce, Creative teams to allow for digital marketing data activations, identify reporting gaps and potential growth opportunities through analyses Help facilitate weekly recaps of core company KPIs; be able to pinpoint where relevant data trends impact core KPIs. Ensure all marketing team members can adequately track and gain insights into their channel’s performance through detailed dashboard visualizations, including Search, Social, Affiliate, CTV, SEO, Email/CRM, and more Assist on ad hoc marketing analysis to better understand efficiencies of channels, promotions, interventions, etc. Bonus points if you have statistical expertise with analyses like regressions and attribution. Work on the development of the technology roadmap to capture, manage, and leverage customer/consumer data to improve digital marketing and personalization initiatives Who You Are Technical (with Marketing and Attribution Data): You are an expert with web analytics and marketing data and have worked with attribution models and databases in the past. Bonus points for any expertise in the following: GA4, Netsuite, Shopify, SEMRush, Google Search Console, Hubspot, Talkable, Amazon Ads and 1P, Google Ads, Meta Ads. Data Native: You have 3+ years’ experience with dashboard and data visualization creation with a proven track record assuming ownership, moving quickly to implement ideas, and delivering results and in a fast-paced e-commerce environment. You have deep knowledge of data platforms and analytics tools, including BI Expertise (Domo/Tableau), SQL, Python, and Excel. Critical Analytical Thinker: You are comfortable and familiar with collecting and analyzing internal and external data. With a data driven mindset, you pinpoint and articulate problem areas and are comfortable in an environment of change and improvement. You are confident in creating and presenting solutions to your cross functional partners and leaders. You have at least a basic understanding of statistical testing and experimentation. Collaborative & Communicative: You work hard and work well with other departments and teams. You listen to feedback and listen to your team and co-workers needs and expectations. You ensure the teams you work with know where projects stand. You have a strong ability to prioritize projects with minimal supervision. Hydrow has recently updated many of our data sources, including switching from GAU to GA4, adding BigQuery, replatforming our website, adding new channels like Amazon, and starting new attribution tracking. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting exceptional candidates, for that reason if you don't meet 100% of the job description, that's okay! Please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you. How We Work Authentic and Inclusive: We embrace each and every one of our differences and celebrate our diversity. We commit to fostering a space where everyone belongs and is heard. Nimble with Purpose: We are a fleet of speedy boats, instead of a barge. As pathfinders of positive change, we adapt our focus with ease when our purpose points us in a new direction Resilient Teammates: We support our Hydrow teammates and members through challenges: technical, personal, or unexpected waves. We overcome the present obstacle and persevere together. Hydrow is a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate individual differences and recognize that unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and more successful. Hydrow actively seeks applicants who can bring a variety of experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds to the team. Hydrow provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sex, pregnancy, pregnancy-related condition, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, qualified handicap, gender identity, results of genetic testing, military status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our team values diversity in experience and backgrounds—we do our best work when we create space for different voices and perspectives. Whatever unique experiences or skill sets you bring, we look forward to learning from each other. BENEFITS AND PERKS (Full Time Permanent Hydrownauts) 🩺 Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Premiums 100% Paid For By Hydrow 👶 6 Months Fully Paid Primary and Secondary Parental Leave 🏖 Unlimited PTO Policy 📚 $150/week Reimbursable for Childcare 🏦 401k 🚣 Free Membership to the Hydrow App and access to a free Hydrow ➕ MORE! By submitting your application, you agree that Hydrow may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Hydrow's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Hydrow's use of your personal information. Hydrow is an E-Verify employer. We are looking to hire either a local part-time (contract but will eventually transition to a full-time position) Edmonton SEO Specialist or a remote freelance candidate in Canada where their duties can be performed from anywhere in Canada. Our first choice will always be someone locally who can participate in our dynamic and healthy culture. Five Jars is looking for an experienced and results-driven Digital Marketing Manager to implement the company’s strategy and actively participate in business development via marketing activities. You are the right person for this position if you are ready to take on a new challenge, contribute to the growth of a US-based digital agency, and help us tell about our services to inspiring organizations. Who are we Five Jars is a Full-service Design, Strategy, and Web Development digital agency that creates intuitive, data-driven web experiences. Over the past 6 years, we've delivered more than 100 projects for clients in a variety of industries, including health & fitness, media, arts & culture, and NGOs. This includes content creation, scheduling, monitoring, and analyzing trends and performance Discovery of new marketing channels to increase the number of marketing leads (hypothesis generation, launching, and tracking) Management and growth of referral platforms Developing strategies to grow the email list and improve engagement and conversion rates Managing and launching digital marketing campaigns (like ads and placements, email marketing, content marketing, lead magnets, podcasts, and webinars) Brand Awareness: Participating in industry awards to enhance brand reputation and credibility Engagement with target business and tech communities Strategy and coordination of trade shows and offline and online events Website Optimization: Managing Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Search Engine Marketing (SEM) efforts to increase the agency's visibility in search engine results pages (SERPs) Overseeing the creation and distribution of engaging, relevant content across various platforms, such as the agency’s blog, website, and social media channels. Ensuring that content is optimized for both search engines and user engagement Overseeing the agency’s website, ensuring it is visually appealing, user-friendly, and up-to-date. Collaborating with web developers and designers to enhance the website’s functionality and design Performance Analysis: Regularly analyze and report on the performance of digital marketing activities, to ensure optimal resource use and high ROI, using tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or similar. Using insights from data to refine and optimize the marketing strategy Budget management to ensure high ROI Team Leadership and Collaboration: Marketing team management and cross-departmental collaboration (sales, design, development, management, HR, etc.) Continuous Learning: Keeping up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends, tools, and best practices, especially those relevant to the web development industry We offer Fair compensation Professional growth and regular performance reviews Benefits such as vacation, sick leave, a day off during official national holidays Medical and dental insurance Remote work or in the office in Arlington, VA Flexible schedule and 7-hour working day Happy Hour every Friday with team members Help with learning new things (courses, books, etc.) Support in participating in conferences Warm and friendly working environment Flexibility in making decisions, no micromanagement Team building and other sorts of online/offline team activities The goal for the position The Digital Marketing Manager aims to strategically boost lead generation through diverse digital channels. Evaluation of Success for this Role Success hinges on quantifiable metrics, specifically increasing total MQLs (Marketing Qualified Leads) and optimizing the growth and conversion of MQLs (Marketing Qualified Leads) into SQLs (Sales Qualified Leads). Regularly analyzing and reporting on the performance of strategies will help determine how well they align with broader marketing and sales objectives. company_name: Visiting Angels of Jenkintown, Horsham, Chadds Ford & Havertown, PA
job_summary: About Us: Visiting Angels is a leading home care agency dedicated to providing compassionate and personalized care to seniors in the comfort of their homes. With a commitment to enhancing the quality of life for our clients, we are seeking a talented and motivated Digital Outreach Coordinator to join our team and help us expand our online presence. Visiting Angels of Jenkintown has been in business since 2004 and has been recognized as the Best Provider of Choice since 2010. Job Description: We are looking for an experienced Digital Outreach Coordinator to manage all search engine optimization and marketing activities as well as manage leads and intake calls. You will be responsible for developing and implementing effective SEO strategies to drive organic traffic to our website, improve search engine rankings, and increase online visibility. This role reports into Marketing Director. Responsibilities for managing Google PPC and SEO strategies : Conduct keyword research to identify target keywords and phrases relevant to our industry and services. Optimize website content, landing pages, and meta-tags for search engines to improve organic search rankings. Develop and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to increase website visibility and drive qualified traffic. Monitor and analyze website performance using SEO tools, Google Analytics, and other relevant platforms. Stay updated on industry trends and search engine algorithms to ensure the website remains optimized for search engines. Collaborate with content creators to develop SEO-friendly content that aligns with target keywords and engages our audience. Implement link-building strategies to enhance the website's authority and credibility. Track, analyze, and report on key SEO metrics and performance indicators. Collaborate with the marketing team to align SEO strategies with overall marketing goals. Provide recommendations for website improvements, both in terms of SEO and user experience. Responsibilities for managing leads and intake calls: Gather essential information about the potential client, including their medical history, current health condition, and specific care needs. Ensure accurate and thorough documentation of client information. This may include personal details, medical history, preferences, and any specific requirements. Coordinate with other team members, such as caregivers and nurses, to schedule services based on the client's preferences and requirements. Conduct follow-up calls to assess the client's satisfaction with the provided services and make any necessary adjustments to the care plan. Qualifications: Proven experience as a Digital Outreach Coordinator or similar role. In-depth knowledge of search engine algorithms and ranking factors. Familiarity with SEO tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, and Google Analytics. Solid understanding of on-page and off-page SEO best practices. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Up to date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO. Demonstrates a deep understanding of client intake processes, care planning, and home care services. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with clients, their families, and internal team members. Clear communication is crucial for understanding and conveying care plans. The ability to empathize with clients and their families, demonstrating a compassionate approach in understanding their needs and concerns. Excellent organizational skills to manage client information, documentation, and scheduling effectively. Ability to collaborate with other members of the home care team, including caregivers, nurses, and administrative staff, to ensure a coordinated and comprehensive approach to client care. Education and Experience:  Bachelors degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, or a related field.  Proven experience in developing and implementing successful PPC and SEO strategies.  Several years of experience in a similar role within the home care or healthcare industry, demonstrating a deep understanding of client intake processes, care planning, and home care services. If you are passionate about Google PPC and SEO and have a proven track record of driving organic traffic and improving search engine rankings, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Visiting Angels. Apply now to be a key player in expanding our online presence and making a positive impact on the lives of seniors in our community. ALL APPLICANTS MUST BE ABLE TO PROVIDE PROOF OF VACCINATION. SEO Manager An award-winning digital marketing agency has an immediate opening for an SEO Manager . As SEO Manager, you would be responsible for the service and management of a diverse portfolio of organic marketing programs for multiple high-profile accounts. As an agency, Gen3 Marketing provides clients with “white hat” SEO solutions that keep their website(s) in alignment with Google’s best practices for online content. Our recommendations often improve both user and search engine crawler experience, which in turn benefit our clients’ website performance. Our mission is to identify opportunities and apply optimizations that users and search engines prefer, enabling our clients to grow their online business and make the most of web traffic from all channels. Requirements & Responsibilities: Supporting strategy, planning, and analysis for client on-site and off-site SEO campaigns. Proficiently managing time and prioritizing tasks to meet monthly service allocations, demonstrating flexibility within set timelines while collaborating effectively within a team-oriented environment. Adaptively understanding client needs, crafting bespoke solutions that align with their objectives. This involves attentive listening, anticipating perspectives, and delivering targeted strategies. Conducting keyword and competitor research to support actionable recommendations. Reviewing opportunities for improving client websites from a technical perspective, including the resolution of errors and optimization of page speed performance. Manually reviewing crawl data to identify and prioritize solutions that will improve the quality and user experience on client websites. Monitoring and reporting on client website performance, including wins and opportunities. Implementing approved SEO recommendations on the behalf of clients. Drafting high-quality, original, well-researched written copy for client marketing campaigns. Editing both internally written and client-provided copy. Vetting potential link partners, drafting scripts, and conducting outreach campaigns to secure paid and organic placements on third-party websites. Publishing approved content and optimizations on the behalf of clients. Formalizing and presenting recommendations to clients for approval. Leveraging third-party tools, such as SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Moz, and Majestic to identify technical, content, and outreach opportunities. Communicating findings and recommendations to clients over the phone, email, and teleconference. Optimizing on-site content, including titles, meta descriptions, internal links, and more. Preferred Experience & Skills: Applicants with intermediate to advanced SEO experience are highly preferred. Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to interpret data, draw conclusions, identify opportunities, and provide succinct recommendations. Hustle and an exceptional work ethic. Exceptional attention to detail. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. A quick study results who’s driven and willing to proactively research solutions. Strong observational and problem-solving skills. Comprehension and the ability/willingness to speak to current industry trends. Self-motivated with the ability to both take direction and work independently with minimal supervision. Interest in creative or technical writing (strong writing samples are a plus). Skill and experience with any of the following tools, platforms, and coding languages are a big plus: Basecamp Clockify Drupal Google Analytics Google Drive (Sheets, Docs, etc.) Google Keyword Planner Google Search Console HTML, CSS, JavaScript Magento Majestic Moz Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) Photoshop Salesforce (Demandware) Screaming Frog SEMrush Shopify WordPress Location: Canada and US locations will be considered except for the following US States:Washington, California, Nevada, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Colorado Connecticut, Maryland, Rhode Island. Benefits: Growth Opportunities within the company The chance to develop your expertise skills, with a creative and high-performing international team Competitive salary Work from home Paid Company Holidays 15 PTO days Show more Show less

job_title: Remote Paid Search Specialist (PPC) - Nationwide, US
job_summary: This is a remote position and is open to candidates anywhere in the United States. Job Summary The Paid Search Specialist works with Brafton's Manager of Paid Search to create, polish, and execute successful PPC campaigns for our clients. He or she is an independent contributor who is comfortable launching, managing and optimizing campaigns. The Paid Search Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of successful paid search efforts, including: Account, campaign and ad group set up Conversion tracking Ad copy creation Keyword research and selection Budget management Report creation and presentation REPORTING This role is within Brafton's Paid Search team and reports into the Manager of Paid Search. Essential Job Functions Research and create PPC campaigns: Define keyword targets using various tools such as SEM Rush, SpyFu and Google Keyword Planner. Advise on monthly campaign spend levels with the client's budget and goals in mind. Create and/or revise ad copy and messaging. Set up all components of campaigns and ad groups, including ensuring that all tracking is correctly and fully implemented. Create and present compelling paid search proposals/audits. Successfully execute planned campaigns - optimizing on a daily basis, as necessary, in Google Ads or any other tools and platforms in use. Report on your results internally and externally in a clear, compelling fashion. Collaborate closely with the account’s internal stakeholders and client contacts. Bring a consultative approach to client campaigns, proactively ideating around and bringing forth the best possible paid search strategies to achieve client's marketing goals within budget. Understand PPC best practices and provide insight through client deliverables. Reliable management and reporting of monthly assigned PPC work. KEY SUCCESS FACTORS Strong working knowledge of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, conversion tracking and ROI based digital ad campaigns. Demonstrated ability to successfully manage PPC campaigns for B2B/B2C clients. Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and video call). The ability to craft a compelling proposal. The ability to create clear reports with riveting ROI narrative. Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills. The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours. Meet scheduled and proposed deadlines. The drive to consistently improve upon current ROAS and other PPC metrics (CTR, CPC, CPA, etc.). SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS: (Required for external job postings) Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum two years of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expert knowledge with the following technologies/software/programs/processes: Google: Ads, Keyword Planner Tool, Search Console, Analytics, gMail Basic Knowledge in or experience with similar tools such as: SearchAds360, SEMRush, Searchmetrics, Raven Tools, Buzzsuomo, Moz, Wordstream, Spyfu, or similar platforms. Basic knowledge of PPC conversion tracking and ability to troubleshoot assignments. Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly Ability to meet deadlines within a fast-paced marketing Agency environment TIME BREAKOUT: 20 percent client communication 20 percent internal communication 40 percent execution/production 10 percent reporting 10 percent miscellaneous To learn more about Brafton, CHECK US OUT HERE Benefits Include: Health, Dental, Vision, Colonial Life, 401k with Match, Paid Time Off, remote work perks and more! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training. Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Brafton (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Are you naturally curious and want to make a big impact using your experienced account management and marketing experience to provide insight and action? Tidal Health Group is a growing Healthcare Marketing and Technology agency. We are a tight team dedicated to strategically helping our clients position themselves as healthcare authorities where data is our “truth” for continued improvement. This is a mid level role that will report to a senior account manager. If you thrive as a self-starter and wants an immediate impact on our and our client's business this role is for you. We have a distributed team and encourage local and remote candidates to apply. What is important to understand about our culture: Time management is in the eye of the beholder. You need to be a proactive self-starter that knows how to best use your, and other team members', skills to be most productive. Because you are here your opinion not only matters, it has a seat at the table. Question. Question. Question. Do not hesitate to make comments and ask questions when something doesn’t make sense or you simply don’t understand. Do not wait to be handed something perfectly polished. We each individually and collectively have the path to pave our way towards growth. Taking initiative is encouraged. We often pick up and put down new projects, and ideas because we are able to test them quickly. Each of us has a title and a primary function. That helps identify our known strengths. But that can account for only a percentage of our day and often fluctuates. The company and client needs can switch permanently or become a short term priority. If a gap is seen within our work, raise your hand for the challenge. Feedback will come in many different shapes and sizes. Expect it to come informally and quickly. Our ability to adapt and learn quickly is our strength. Learning, loads of learning, is a core motivation we all share. With lots of freedom to experiment, world-class colleagues, and competitive small business benefits. The immediate focus areas for this role: Account management - bring an experienced and advisory perspective to our clients. Understand how to navigate full scope digital marketing campaigns and drive simple and actionable insight. Internal Account management - own the “client” of us. You have the tools of individual specialists on your team but an overall vision and management of our own campaigns is needed. Direct Experience Team Management Client Communication Knowledge of (preferable 5+ years): Data Visualization Tools (ie - Datastudio/Lookr) Google Workspace WordPress Google Analytics Google/Bing Ads SEO, SEM, PPC Asana/PM Tools Must Haves: Account management, preferably in an agency setting Thrive in a team environment Hunger to learn and solve new problems Understanding how different services work together in the digital marketing space Responsibilities: Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at Tidal, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships Proven experience planning and executing digital marketing campaigns. Experience with SEO/SEM and CRM software. Experience implementing and optimizing Google Adwords campaigns. Solid knowledge of web analytics tools like Google Analytics, SEMRush, Google AdWords, GTMetrix. Hands on experience with online marketing tools and practices. Experience with WordPress, and familiarity with web design and HTML. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong analytical and project management skills. Self-starter who needs little supervision to stay on task. Compensation/Company Benefits: Option for remote work Competitive Salary 2 weeks paid vacation 14 Paid Holidays Company Health, Dental, Vision Insurance Company Performance Bonus Paid Parental Leave Educational OR Remote Stipend Paid Birthday Off 1 week paid professional development time Show more Show less

Company Description At Marketplace, our mission is to help readers turn their aspirations into reality. We arm people with trusted advice and guidance, so they can make informed decisions they feel confident in and get back to doing the things they care about most. We are an experienced team of industry experts dedicated to helping readers make smart decisions and choose the right products with ease. Marketplace boasts decades of experience across dozens of geographies and teams, including Content, SEO, Business Intelligence, Finance, HR, Marketing, Production, Technology and Sales. The team brings rich industry knowledge to Marketplace’s global coverage of consumer credit, debt, health, home improvement, banking, investing, credit cards, small business, education, insurance, loans, real estate and travel. Job Description We are seeking a talented individual to come to help Forbes Marketplace grow our offering in the US for financial services information and advice to consumers. We need you to help take us to the next level. We have big aspirations, and you’ll have all the tools and resources needed at your disposal to make us the #1 organic site for the following financial services verticals: Credit Cards and Travel Rewards. If you're looking for challenges and opportunities similar to those of a startup, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then read on: Responsibilities: Work in partnership with the SEO manager and several Jr. SEOs to build out the editorial roadmaps Lead a team of two Jr. SEOs in managing your verticals and fostering their career growth. In hand with the SEO manager and sales/BD teams, identify and implement opportunities to derive more revenue from individual pages through CRO strategy and A/B test analysis and implementation. Conduct detailed keyword research to find the most relevant and effective terms/phrases with the highest ROI Analyse high-performing competitor domains to provide insight and opportunities for future growth Optimize current content including the title tag and meta description, headers, and copy through robust content briefs to improve ranking and internal linking improvements Compile backlink analysis to assist SEO team with outreach opportunities Run site crawls, build templates, and construct data visuals for tracking, analyzing, implementing, and reporting on site updates that drive positive change. Monitor and analyze overall site performance including rankings and conversion About You: At least 3-4 years of SEO experience Experience managing direct reports (even if at the intern level) Experience with on-page SEO including keyword research, competitive analysis, internal linking, and content briefs Experience with off-page SEO -- you’ve worked on outreach projects before and have sourced relevant external web pages Experience with conversion rate optimization (CRO) and working with sales to identify and implement opportunities to grow conversion rate and revenue. Experience with data analysis – you’re very data-oriented and able to use data to support the strategies you pitch to implement on site You’ve used SEO tools like Ahrefs, SEMRush, GSC, and Google Analytics Working knowledge of technical SEO elements such as schema, canonicals and site speed Have a passion for continued learning and staying up to date on industry news Highly organized, with very strong attention to detail Skilled in time management and working autonomously – you’re able to take action where and when needed (based on data analysis) without requiring specific instruction Knowledge and experience with WordPress and other CMS Experience within the finance industry, and preferably in credit cards and travel reward Team player with a positive attitude Benefits: Competitive compensation package Ability to work remotely Unlimited PTO Every third Friday of the month off Winter break closure; the week between Christmas and New Years Home office setup Wellness Reimbursement Additional Information Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. About Swing Founded in 2015 by former K-12 educators and administrators, Swing Education is one of the leading platforms assisting school districts in sourcing dependable, highly qualified substitute teachers. At the core of our company stands a diverse and visionary leadership team. In the face of a nationwide teacher shortage, Swing believes that every classroom should have a teacher, and every student deserves uninterrupted learning. By establishing a marketplace that facilitates seamless connections between substitute teachers and schools, Swing aims to streamline the pathway for K-12 schools and districts to access reliable, top-tier substitute teachers when they're needed most. At Swing, we champion a fundamental belief: for our schools and students to thrive, our team must reflect the rich diversity of the thousands of students and educators we are privileged to serve. This belief is deeply ingrained in our organizational identity, embodying Living DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) as one of Swing's Four Core Values. We committed to creating a work culture that embraces inclusivity and belonging for every member of our present and future team. To learn more about Swing Education, and our Core Values please click here. Position Summary As the Content Marketing Director at Swing Education, you will play a pivotal role in developing and executing content strategies to drive brand awareness, brand engagement, and lead generation. You will lead a team of creative professionals to produce compelling content across various platforms to amplify our brand presence in K-12. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Content Strategy Development: Develop and implement comprehensive content strategies aligned with business objectives and target audiences, utilizing a mix of written, visual, and multimedia content. Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of content creators, including writers, designers, and multimedia specialists, fostering a culture of creativity, collaboration, and high-quality content production. Content Creation and Oversight: Oversee the creation of diverse content assets, including blog posts, articles, whitepapers, case studies, videos, infographics, webinars, social media content, and more. Brand Positioning: Ensure consistency in brand messaging and tone across all content touchpoints, maintaining brand integrity and effectively communicating Swing Education's value propositions. Distribution Channel Expertise: Identify, evaluate, and leverage diverse distribution channels (e.g., social media, email, influencers, partnerships, paid advertising, SEO) to maximize content visibility, engagement, and audience reach. Content Performance Measurement: Track and analyze content performance using relevant metrics and analytics tools, and make data-driven decisions to enhance content effectiveness. Campaign Management: Conceptualize and execute integrated marketing campaigns, leveraging content to drive brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product, sub growth and customer success, to align content strategies with overall business goals and campaigns. Market and Industry Research: Stay updated on education industry trends, market insights, and competitor analysis to identify content opportunities and maintain relevance in the market. Supervisory Responsibilities Proactively identifies team needs and competencies Drives or facilitates interviewing, hiring, and training employees for relevant roles Works with employees to appraise performance; reward employees and drive retention, and address complaints or resolve problems Requirements And Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field. Proven experience (10+ years) in content marketing, preferably in the education or technology sector. Demonstrated success in developing and executing content strategies that drive brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation. Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire creativity and manage multiple projects simultaneously. job_summary: Te ofrecemos un lugar donde desarrollarte personal y profesionalmente, en una organización en crecimiento con sede en una ciudad con buena calidad de vida*, con metas ambiciosas, ambiente colaborativo y bilingüe (español/inglés). Sus objetivos principales son la consolidación de la imagen de marca, la captación de leads de calidad y la fidelización del cliente. Estamos buscando un Junior Digital Analyst, que desempeñará un papel clave en la optimización de la presencia online, analizando datos y tendencias para impulsar estrategias efectivas de marketing online. Responsabilidades: Recabar, analizar e interpretar datos de múltiples fuentes para evaluar el rendimiento del sitio web, redes sociales, campañas de marketing y comportamiento del usuario. Identificar oportunidades de mejora en el rendimiento y usabilidad de la web. Colaborar en la definición y revisión de las estrategias SEO y SMO. Colaborar en el diseño de campañas de marketing digital, incluyendo email marketing, publicidad en redes sociales y SEM. Identificar segmentos de clientes/usuarios para poder personalizar adecuadamente las estrategias y campañas de marketing. Mantenerse al tanto de las tendencias del mercado y realizar análisis comparativos con la competencia para identificar oportunidades y desafíos. Colaborar con otras áreas en caso necesario (gestión interna, recruiting). ¿Qué te ofrecemos? Entorno de trabajo joven, multidisciplinar y bilingüe (español/inglés). Posición 100% presencial (no negociable), formando parte de un amplio equipo. Empresa solvente y en expansión, con distintas áreas de negocio en fase de lanzamiento. Excelente clima laboral, basado en el compromiso y el trabajo en equipo. Horario flexible de 8:30 a 17:00. Viernes, verano y Navidad con jornada intensiva (8:00 a 15:00) Plan de formación continua, incluyendo bolsa económica y de horas. El salario de entrada dependerá del bagaje aportado, con un mínimo de 23.000€ para recién titulados y en cualquier caso plan de carrera hasta el entorno de los 32.000€. Perfil: Es imprescindible contar con título de Grado; idealmente, en ADE o similar, complementado con un Postgrado en Marketing Digital. Es imprescindible dominar el inglés hablado y escrito (al menos C1 fluido). Habilidades analíticas y estadísticas. Conocimientos avanzados de Excel. Idealmente, experiencia con herramientas de Google Marketing Platform (Analytics, Ads, Tag Manager, Trends, etc.), así como Semrush, Metricool y/o similares. À propos Walter Learning conçoit, produit et diffuse des formations en ligne à destination des professionnels, sous plusieurs marques : Walter Learning : formations généralistes (HACCP, bureautique, web & digital, etc.) et formations longues (CAP...) Walter Santé : formations spécialisées pour les médecins, kinés, infirmiers, dentistes, sages-femmes... Le pari de Walter Learning, c’est de proposer un nouveau modèle de formation professionnelle, offrant la flexibilité et la créativité du e-learning, couplées à la rigueur et la justesse attendues par les professionnels. Leur Savoir-faire Se Situe Dans L’alliance Des Sciences De L’éducation, Du Digital Et De L’audiovisuel. Walter Learning C’est Des formations denses, où chaque mot est pesé, Des formateurs reconnus ; Une plateforme d’apprentissage codée-maison, facile d’utilisation ; Un apprentissage souple, sans contraintes ; Un support apprenants aux petits soins. Walter Learning a commencé à commercialiser son produit en mai 2019. Depuis, l’entreprise a démontré une croissance très forte, sur un marché gigantesque, puisqu'elle a vendu plus de 80 000 formations à fin 2023. Walter Learning est autofinancée et déjà rentable. Descriptif du poste En tant que SEO Specialist, vous travaillez au sein de l’équipe Marketing sous la responsabilité du Head of SEO. Votre rôle sera de participer à la stratégie de contenu et à l’optimisation SEO du site afin de booster le trafic et les leads organiques. Vos Missions S'articulent Autour Des Axes Suivants Développer notre stratégie sémantique Vous Serez Chargé.e De Effectuer des recherches de mots-clés sur les champs sémantiques déjà définis ; Définir les nouveaux champs sémantiques liés aux formations en collaboration et mener les recherches correspondantes ; Déterminer les segments prioritaires de la stratégie éditoriale et proposer des applications de cette stratégie au travers de tous nos canaux de contenu. Animer la production de contenus Vous Serez Amené.e à Créer des briefs d’articles SEO à destination de nos rédacteur.rice.s ; Réviser les articles (orthographe, grammaire, style et bonnes pratiques SEO) et les publier via notre CMS ; Optimiser le contenu déjà publié ; Rédiger le contenu de nos pages de formation en respectant les bonnes pratiques SEO et les intégrer sur notre site ; Assurer la coordination entre les équipes (Production, Lead, Dev. et Product Designer) ; Travailler sur de nouveaux formats de contenu (landing pages, Youtube, Social Media, etc.). Assurer le suivi de nos résultats et opérer une veille concurrentielle Vous Contribuerez à Effectuer un reporting mensuel consolidé des performances de mots-clés, trafic et conversions SEO ; Assurer une veille SEO et une veille concurrentielle. Le poste est basé à Paris, Métro Sentier (13002). Profil recherché Vous êtes expert(e) en rédaction SEO avec quelques bases techniques Vous avez déjà élaboré une stratégie éditoriale et géré la production de contenu Vous faites preuve de curiosité, d’organisation, de rigueur et d’enthousiasme Vous justifiez d'au moins 1 an d'expérience dans le SEO Vous savez analyser de larges bases de données Vous avez des notions HTML Vous maîtrisez les outils suivants : Google Analytics, Google Search Console, ahrefs/SEMRush, Google Keyword Planner et Excel (Google Data Studio serait un plus) Orthographe et grammaire irréprochables. Déroulement des entretiens Premier entretien avec la Head of SEO Deuxième entretien avec le CMO Informations complémentaires Type de contrat : CDI Lieu : Paris Niveau d'études : Bac +5 / Master Expérience : > 6 mois Télétravail ponctuel autorisé Salaire : entre 30000€ et 35000€ / an Show more Show less

We are on a mission to disrupt the market of old, slow, expensive systems and bring innovative products to restaurants worldwide. We have built a fun workplace culture with a strong team that comes together to bring 100% of what they do. We’re looking for amazing talent to add to our team as an SEO / Web Specialist. This position is best suited for someone experienced on-page, off-page, and technical SEO. We’re looking for an SEO specialist that lives and breaths SEO and is always learning and up to date with the latest SEO practices and Google Algorithm changes. Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale it. About The Role This person will lead the SEO strategy for multiple clients monitoring and reporting their SEO efforts adapting and executing new strategies to continue boosting our client's ranking. Keyword Research and Analysis. Website Audit. Backlink Analysis. Competitor Analysis. Strategy Development. Analytics Google Analytics Setup and Management. Facebook Pixel Setup and Management. Google Search Console / Bing Webmasters Verification and Management. Rankings and Visibility Tracking and Analysis. UTM Management. MOZ PRO. SEO Technical Optimization Indexing and Crawlability Optimization. Redirect Optimization. URL Structure Optimization. Structured Data/Rich Snippets Optimization. Mobile Responsiveness Optimization. Page Speed Optimization. Schema Mark-Up Audit. SEO On-Page Optimization. Keyword Strategy. Ensures that all web pages have keyword-optimized tags. URL Optimization. Tag Optimization. Content Optimization. Website Speed Optimization. SEO Off-Page Optimization: Negative Backlink Audit and Repair. Link Creation (Branding + Reputation). Link Acquisition. Content Marketing. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want anytime, anywhere and can change their plans at any time. About The Team Embedded within the product organization, the SEO team plays an important role in driving organic growth and engagement with our business globally through search engines. We operate horizontally across user acquisition, member discovery, marketing, and customer service teams to strategically optimize websites and content for over 30+ languages, ensuring discoverability and engagement across diverse regions. We are seeking an SEO Specialist who excels at navigating technical SEO, is well versed in editorial SEO, and someone who is able to build and foster strong relationships among various teams. Location This role is based in our Mexico City office in a hybrid model. Some travel to our Los Gatos or Los Angeles office will be required a few times a year. What You’ll Be Doing Develop a deep understanding of Netflix and how SEO can solve user needs throughout the customer journey Be the primary SEO owner for Customer Service while also frequently contributing to projects in other areas of our business Define and implement a strategic SEO roadmap for Customer Service and serve as the primary point of contact for customer and agent search feedback across the CS organization Partner with product management, marketing, engineering, and design to optimize customer journeys and web funnels for search Implement technical SEO improvements, from prioritizing opportunities and writing specs to testing and monitoring performance Continuously identify new SEO opportunities through content gap analysis, competitive research, site audits, and performance monitoring Regularly review and audit content performance on search engines, ensuring discoverability and user engagement across diverse regions Proactively mitigate the impact of ongoing technology changes on search performance and oversee the smooth migration of the Customer Service CMS. Educate product, design, and engineering teams as well as writers, editors, and other stakeholders on SEO best practices and current industry trends We’re Seeking a Candidate Who Has 6+ years of SEO experience, ideally with demonstrated success in global enterprise environments Solid understanding of technical SEO, publishing workflows, and content operations Proficiency in popular tools like Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, and Lumar, Botify, SEMrush, and Ahrefs Strong interpersonal and communication skills to build bridges and collaborate effectively with diverse teams Passion for SEO and innovation, with a keen eye for detail and excellent project management skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, work independently, and analyze data for both quantitative and qualitative insights Show more Show less

job_summary: Who We Are: We are a tech-enabled growth firm at the intersection of marketing, consulting & data intelligence igniting revenue and brand recognition for leading and emerging companies around the world. As a people-first firm, we value diversity in backgrounds and experiences. We strongly believe our people and culture are key to our success. Our vision is to be recognized as the most valued and respected private growth marketing firm in the world–with a scalable brand, culture and services. As a full-service growth marketing firm, we offer best-in-class services including: SEO, Content Marketing, Paid Media, Social Media Marketing, Programmatic + CTV, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing, Email + SMS, Conversion Rate Optimization, Retail Marketing, Creative, and Web Development. Here at Power Digital, we are hyper-focused on helping brands drive revenue growth and brand recognition, ultimately driving irrefutable value for our clients. At the heart of Power Digital is our proprietary technology, nova, which analyzes businesses through first-party data, simplifying investment planning for marketing and diligence in putting marketers in a strategic seat at the table and providing value in unparalleled ways. Managing billions in media, our dynamic team of consultative marketers, creatives, analysts and technologists challenge traditional ways of planning and measurement through meticulous testing and data science across each milestone of the customer journey. **We support 100% remote, in-office, or hybrid work styles for anyone legally eligible to work in the U.S. A day in the life: The Senior Organic Search Strategist’s role is to create and execute on custom Organic Search strategies that align with the client’s KPIs using all aspects of Organic Search including on-page SEO, technical SEO, off-page SEO elements and informational SEO Content. Sr. Strategists are great communicators who can explain SEO and SEO Content strategies to various clients ranging from C-levels, non-marketing POCs to SEO experts. Sr. Strategists explain the “why” behind the strategy in order to get strong buy-in from the client for speedy implementation. This person is a problem solver who pivots their strategy based on account performance leveraging both transactional/lead gen pages as well as article content when needed. Sr. Strategists are constantly learning about updates to Google’s algorithm and brainstorming new strategies to move the needle for clients. This person is a strong internal communicator who also delegates, mentors & coaches junior team members to grow their own skill sets. Responsibilities: Creating short term and long term strategic organic search roadmaps that quantify the traffic and/or lead/transaction impact that the strategy will have on the client’s business goals. Organic search performance deep dives during reporting (monthly/quarterly/yearly) and also when Algorithm Updates occur. Working with large data sets and making slides clear and digestible while tying the story back to our strategic efforts and providing actionable next steps as a result of performance. Explain organic search performance, how it assisted other channels in the funnel, how it affects the client's business, and recommended next steps. This includes being clear, professional and confident in your communication with clients and explaining the "why" behind Organic Search tactics. Delegating relevant workflow to Specialists and/or supporting strategists with clear expectations, relevant information, and timelines. Providing enough time to review the quality of the deliverables and providing the teammate with feedback (as needed). Executing on more complex/outside of the box organic search deliverables that will help clients achieve their business goals. Making educated Organic Search goals & forecasts based on historical client context and current search landscape (and knowing when to adapt or re-forecast as needed). Ownership of updating internal and external deliverable trackers to ensure projects and deliverables are moving along. Role Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of experience in an SEO-based role Advanced understanding of all aspects of organic search including on-page, technical, off-page, and SEO Content. Aligning SEO and Content efforts with priority business focuses. Work autonomously to think outside the box and craft custom organic search strategies as needed to help clients achieve their goals in an attempt to maintain client retention. Advanced knowledge and experience using analytical tools necessary for SEO performance and reporting including Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMRush, AHREFs, Moz, Screaming Frog, & others. Keeping up with industry best practices and changing SERP landscape. Ability to provide positive and constructive feedback to team members who are supporting on accounts. Bonus if you have experience training other team members. Strong time management and organizational skills when it comes to roadmapping strategy, planning deliverables, delegating tasks, and reviewing tasks Proactive & solution oriented problem solver related to both client accounts and internal situations. You have a team-player mentality. Excellent storyteller with strong presentation skills to tailor messages to audiences, communicate complex topics simply, and deliver actionable insights and analyses Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) Hit RPE success metric ($36k) Below 10% Client Churn Rate Range of the number of accounts (5-10) Most Important Things (MITs) Manage accounts with the highest workflow volume or complexity with positive feedback → primarily working on Enterprise and/or Growth accounts Identifies biggest SEO and Content opportunities based off client goals & provides clear strategic roadmap for execution Working with the team to delegate SEO/Content tasks and receive them back with enough time to review so that you are always hitting deadlines in regards to client workflow with minimal errors (no typos, grammatical issues). Strong attention to detail with minimal review from Account Managers and Account Directors. Benefits & Perks: Base salary + commission opportunities Robust Medical, Dental, Vision insurance plans with up to 100% employer contribution towards employee monthly premium 401(k) plan - 4% employer contribution matching Unlimited Time Off available on day one Fully flex work environment: full-remote, in-office, or hybrid Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 12 observed national holidays + 2 mental health recharge days per year Unlimited opportunities for growth & leadership within a rapidly growing firm Ongoing employee development programs for personal and professional growth (Hedgehog and Vital 5s) Quarterly awards including prize money and recognition for outstanding performance Opportunities to be involved in company DEI initiatives Power Digital’s people and culture are at the core of our success, which is why diversity in our team’s backgrounds and experiences are paramount. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences, and backgrounds, who strive to make an impact inside and outside of the workplace. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one’s identity. All of our employees' points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility. Please be aware of fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers from suspicious sources. These engagements may be an attempt to obtain private information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Power Digital does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted on our careers page at https://www.linkedin.com/careersite/powerdigital. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any messaging behalf of Power Digital, please send us an email at recruiting@powerdigital.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence. Who We Are: At Amsive , we're more than just a performance marketing agency; we're a team that thrives on collaboration and innovation. We offer a supportive environment where personal growth is just as important as professional development. We're a team of passionate individuals ready to tackle challenges, learn from one another, and drive results. We believe in empowering our team members, providing them with the tools they need to succeed, and trusting them to lead the way. With decades of expertise and a commitment to integrated solutions, we don't meet the industry standard; we're setting it. If you're looking for a place where your work matters, a career path you can grow on your terms, and a team that's as invested in your success as you are, Amsive is for you. We offer a unique blend of flexibility, growth opportunities, and a culture that values each individual. Join us, and be part of the team ready to welcome, support, and grow with you. **This is a REMOTE position. We’re looking for a curious problem solver to lead a small team and support our wider department with technical site auditing, website migrations, and helping develop impactful, data-driven SEO strategies for our clients. The role is a stepping stone to becoming an independent team lead as a Strategist, SEO. You should have a passion for the digital world, a propensity to problem-solve, phenomenal attention to detail, and a boundless desire to learn. Our most successful team members are often both "right-brained" (creative) and "left-brained" (analytical). They are also strong team players, as collaboration and education are very important within our SEO department. What you will be doing: Help develop and own the strategy, roadmap, and day-to-day activities of technical SEO activities for a few key accounts Lead a handful of bi-weekly client cadence calls (assisted by dedicated account coordinators or managers and/or directors, as needed) Grow into an independent SEO team leader Conduct comprehensive, prioritized site audits and proactively identify on-page content and technical SEO opportunities that drive organic traffic at scale Document recommended solutions in a concise and compelling manner, working with development teams to advise on implementation Ability to develop realistic business cases to convince SEO clients to prioritize and implement SEO initiatives Ability to derive strategic keyword evaluations to drive successful initiatives based on attainable organic search opportunities Monitor and analyze site performance using a range of SEO and site analytics tools Interpret and explain data discoveries as they relate to organic search, specific SEO initiatives, and client KPIs Develop and effectively communicate SEO strategies, deliverables, and results to clients Stay up to date on current SEO industry trends and technologies and proactively communicate such trends to clients and the broader SEO department Perform competitive analyses to identify organic search opportunities Identify opportunities to improve organic conversion rates Supervise QA of SEO implementations Who you are: Minimum 4-6 years of experience contributing to or managing successful SEO campaigns, preferably in an agency setting Understanding of current SEO best practices, search engine ranking factors, intermediate marketing principles, and a strong grasp on how to help clients meet business goals as realistically as possible, setting the right expectations Intermediate understanding of concepts such as URL discovery, crawling, rendering, indexing, and ‘crawl budget’ Understanding of web performance and page speed optimizations Inside-out knowledge of Screaming Frog and Google Search Console Experience using other SEO tools such as Botify, Lumar (DeepCrawl), OnCrawl, SiteBulb, Ryte, and BrightEdge, STAT, Conductor, SEMrush, Ahrefs, etc. Strong written and verbal communication skills, a positive attitude, and the ability to thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment Strong project management and organization skills, ability to be flexible and adaptable and prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects Experience with Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, and connected APIs for data analysis and reporting Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (as it relates to SEO) If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity at Amsive, or if you need reasonable accommodation with
